loans.name: Johayna

texts.en:
Johayna is a 44-year-old married mother of two, one of whom is enrolled in a private school.  Her husband left her and their children alone in Lebanon while he went to seek a better income and to cover his family's increasing needs abroad. In an effort to help support their family, she started her own home business. Johayna prepares catered home-made food for special occasions and her special taste is highly appreciated by relatives and residents in the area. 

Jonayna is acquiring a new loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. The previous loans made a productive impact on her business and helped her cover most of her needs. Now she will be purchasing serving trays and equipment for desserts, which improves the quality of her buffet and generates more growth for her business. In the future she hopes to have enough savings to open a small restaurant where she can further explore her talents.

loans.use: To purchase serving trays and equipment for desserts

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunzaya, 27 years old, lives with her husband and son in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a manager at a heavy automobile training center for six months. Her husband operates a crane at a mining company. Her family lives in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Recently Ariunzaya and her husband began to build their own house, which is almost finished. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy shingles, planks and vacuum-insulated windows to complete her house. Living in a house is much better than living in a ger in many ways, such as comfort and warmth. A high-quality house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and thus release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy shingles, planks and vacuum-insulated windows

loans.name: Rito

texts.en: Rito is married with three children and runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than two years, earning income for the family's basic needs. To improve his services, he needs to repair his existing vehicle. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, used for motor repair. Now he is planning to replace the old tires in order to maintain safety. He has taken a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy tires. Rito wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tires

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma previously obtained a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her youngest child’s education and for their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. 

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Norma dreams to get a better place for her business and hopes that she will still be able to help her children and grandchildren even when she is too old to work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina owns and operates farmland in their community to earn a living. She raises large cattle at the farm, and she earns better income from this. 

To buy additional large cattle to raise, she took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC).

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve their living.

loans.use: to buy additional large cattle to raise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting another PHP 45,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes that her neighbors will continue to patronize her store. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and cover daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bella hopes to increase in her finances and grow spiritually. She also dreams of having her own car and house and lot. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Rosma

texts.en:
Rosma previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and a greater variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and with the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Rosma would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosma dreams of owning a house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear items.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. 

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items like curls, bread, soft drinks, spices, and other groceries.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like curls, bread, soft drinks, spices, and other groceries.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials like cement and sand for her business.

Andresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement and sand for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 53 years old and widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anita has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. 

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Ronny De Jesus

texts.es: Ronny es un hombre solitario que encontró en la venta de animales una compañía y una forma de vivir y lo más importante actividad que se enorgullece de ejercerla y lo hace muy feliz, como todo persona aspira a tener mejores ingresos, crecer como empresa o incluso comenzar a emplear gente y con este pensamiento que el señor Ronny solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos con los que espera mejorar sus ganancias e ir creando un fondo para pensar en ampliar su negocio o adentrarse en la venta de otro tipo de animales como ganado o pollos
texts.en: Ronny is a single man who has found in selling animals some companionship and a way of living and most importantly an activity that he is proud to do and makes him happy. As with all people he wants to make more money, expand his business including maybe starting to employ people. With this in mind Ronny is requesting a loan to buy pigs that he hopes will increase his revenues. He wants to build a fund to be able to expand his business or venture into the sale of other kinds of animals like cattle or chickens.

loans.use: to buy pigs to increase his income.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es: Cuando Katia quedó desempleada, su amiga le compartió su experincia en la comercialización de productos mediante guias especializadas y esto la ayudó a tomar la decisión de emprender su actividad comercial. Hoy ofrece articulos como calzado, medicamentos naturales, ropa interior y exterior. Su meta es ampliar su estructura física con vitrinas, estanteria y adicionarle mercancia para contar con un stock en su oferta;  a nivel familiar mas adelante planea hacer mejoramiento a sus condiciones habitacionales, por eso sus esfuerzos están dirigidos al crecimiento de su negocio. En la actualidad Katia está aplicando a un crdikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, medicamentos naturales, articulos para el hogar y ropa, todas estas mercancias aparecen en sus catalogos con descuentos especiales, que ofrecerá a sus clientes para captal su atenión interés y accion de compra, con la que mueve sus ingresos de manera ascendente.
texts.en:
When Katia found herself unemployed a friend shared her experience in selling products through specialty catalogs and this helped her make the decision to start in a commercial activity. Today she sells things like footwear, natural medicines and inner and outer clothing. Her goal is to expand her infrastructure with display cases, shelving and more merchandise to have a stock of what she offers. On a family level in the future she hopes to make improvements in their living conditions. So she is directing her efforts to expanding her business.

Katia is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy footwear, natural medicines, household goods and clothing. All this merchandise is in her catalogs at discounted prices which she will offer to her clients to capture their attention, interest and ultimately their buying. This will boost her revenues upwards.

loans.use: to buy footwear, natural medicines, household goods and clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old woman, married with five children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a member of a solidarity group where members guarantee each other to get a loan. 

She has been in a tea-buying business that she has been operating for eight years in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. She obtains additional income from farming where she complains of unpredictable weather changes and the general problem of price fluctuations. Rose has hopes of looking after her family since she is the sole bread winner. 

She is requesting a loan to rent tea estates to harvest tea to sell.

loans.use: to rent tea estates to harvest tea to sell.

loans.name: Davy Group

texts.en:
Davy is 45 years old. She is a married mother of six children, living in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. 

Davy is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Davy hopes that she can buy a hand-tractor and build a new house.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Al Ikhlas 1 Group

texts.en:
Maryam is the featured representative of Al Ikhlas 1 group. She and the other members of this group loan are best friends, and they’ve acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua so that they can improve their livelihoods together.

Maryam is a 57-year-old widowed mother of nine. After the death of her husband she struggled to provide her children with good living standards. She is a tailor and has been working in a tailoring factory since 2004. She has learned this profession from her parents who have trained her well. At first Maryam faced the challenge of making it to the factory's early working hours on time, but has since proved her reliability and commitment to her supervisors. 

Maryam has also worked in agriculture for the past 10 years, and she puts so much effort on developing her own business properly to make sure she can acquire a good income.

Currently she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay the painting fees of her house to keep it a healthy living place. She is sitting in the far left side of the picture. Khadija is the lady wearing black at the far right side, while Ayat is the lady at the center.

loans.use: To pay the painting fees of her house to keep it a healthy living place

loans.name: Ariunjin

texts.en:
Ariunjin, 36 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power plant for more than twenty years. His wife has recently begun to work as a janitor at the Ministry of Defense. 

Ariunjin is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy an electric car for transportation. The distance between his work place and home is great and going by bus will take great deal of time, reducing work efficiency. Also the electric car has advantage of wasting less fuel and emitting less smoke.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 24-year-old single man and the sole earner of his family. He left his hometown in Syria to seek a better work opportunity in Lebanon.

A few months ago he established his own aluminum workshop and has been able to employ an individual to help him. Khaled quit school at an early age and has been working in this field for eight years. Now he is well known among his clients for his clean and reliable work.

Since he successfully repaid a previous loan with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, Khaled is acquiring a new YOUTH loan to establish a blacksmith business.  He needs to buy the requested business tools and other needed items, which he hopes will increase his revenue. 

One day he dreams of opening a shop that sells brick and iron materials next to his other workshops.

loans.use: to establish a blacksmith business and buy the requested business tools and needed items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Being a hard-working mother, Erlinda supports her husband in planting vegetables for sale. She is 56 years old and blessed with five children. Together with her husband, she aspires to improve their standard of living to give their children a better future. With this in mind, they planned to expand their vegetable plantation to ensure a high production.

 Due to financial insufficiency, Erlinda wants to access a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in growing vegetables. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request so they can expand their vegetable plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in growing vegetables

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra  and her husband are engaged in farming, to provide for the needs of the family. They cultivate bananas and root crops, and also harvest coconuts for sale. Alejandra has been doing these activities for many years. She has been successfully repaying her previous loans used for farming. She always find ways to improve their produce and fertilization is one of the ways. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.
She hopes to see her children successful and have better living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en:
Alfa previously obtained a 50,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase additional stock of LPG tanks needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that she will use to pay for additional stock of LPG tanks needed for her business. More items to sell will result in better profits. 

The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alfa dreams that her children will all finish their studies and hopes to begin an additional business, if possible. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* family members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a 64-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with his family. 

For over 21 years, Romeo was able to manage his transportation services along with his buy and sell business that absolutely met the needs of his family. With his generated revenue, he was able to save for their future needs. 

Recently, he took a new loan to cover motorcycle maintenance costs to improve the services and to ensure safety. 

In the future, he wants to own a four-wheeled vehicle to improve the business.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, a father of four, provides transportation services in their village to make a living.

For more than two years he has earned well to provide for the family.  He needs to repair and maintain his motorcycle to improve the services to his customers. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future he wants to acquire a new motorcycle unit to use it for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married and operates a paint supply business while her husband does fishing for a living.

With four years in running the business, Eva was happy to say that this helps her family a lot while waiting for their fishing activities.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy more paints to resell. In the future, she wants to have a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more paints to resell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 32 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 9,250 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Emma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Evic

texts.en:
Evic works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2013. She is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Evic will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. Evic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 31 years old, married with five children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Margie has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to offer for sale.

Margie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 49 years old, married with two children, and both are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her native hat weaving business and been in NWTF since 2009. She is now requesting a 9,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Marlina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Marlina would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 60 years old and married with three children. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lorna has been an NWTF borrower since 2010.  With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Margret, a farmer living in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya in her 2.75 acres of land. She lives there with her husband and they have five children. She has been doing farming for the past 25 years, rearing poultry and growing tea, bananas, and a variety of vegetables.  Besides farming, she has a retail business which acts as an extra source of income for her. She really enjoys spending her time in the farm, but her biggest challenge is poor market conditions for her farm produce.

Margret would like to buy more poultry for more egg production and she says that this loan will help her to purchase the poultry she needs. “Through this loan, I will expand my farming activities and also get more income which will enable me to cater for my family’s needs comfortably.”

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella used the previous loan to buy beer to sell. She has a personal goal of educating her children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications. 

She has been running a food business for the last ten years and her main hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to buy enough stock. 

She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Stella needs a loan to buy beer, sodas, and food for the restaurant to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, and food for the restaurant to sell

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
Manuel es un respetado vendedor de cerdos con una experiencia de 20 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que ha alimentado a su familia conformada por su esposa y dos hijos. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como cuido para los cerdos y ciertos materiales de aseo ya que sus establecimientos se destacan por el higiene y el resto lo destinara para la compra de cerdos ya que se trazó una meta de adquirir suficiente capital para comprar un terreno para iniciar actividades agrícolas con las que pueda alimentarse y vender a vecinos y amigos
texts.en:
Manuel is a respected pig seller with 20 years of experience. He learned this business from his parents and it has fed his family, which is composed of his wife and two children.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies like feed for the pigs and certain cleaning materials, as his establishment is distinguished by its hygiene. The rest will be destined for the purchase of pigs. He has set a goal for himself of earning sufficient capital to buy land to start farming activities with which he could feed himself and sell to neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to buy supplies like pig feed, cleaning materials for his establishment, and pigs to increase his sales business

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru: Гулистон добрая и общительная женщина в возрасте 54 года. Она с семьей живет на районе Носири Хустав. Она очень активная женщина. Гулистон занимается животноводством и растениеводством одновременно. У нее дома имеется 5 голов скотин. Она любит животных, и ухаживать за ними. Так же у нее есть гектар земли, на котором посажена картошка. Ко всему это Гулистон хочет начать новую деятельность совсем в иную сторону. Она будет заниматься продажей продуктов питания. Из-за того, что у нее не хватает начального капитала и Гулистон решила обратиться за кредитом. На эти деньги она купит продукты на продажу.
texts.en: Guliton is a kind, sociable 54-year-old woman. She lives with her family in the Nosiri Hustav region. She is a very active woman. Guliton is engaged in cattle raising and farming. Her home has 5 heads of cattle. She loves animals and takes care of them. She also has a hectare of land, on which she plants potatoes. On top of all this, Guliton wants to start a new activity in an entirely different direction. She will sell food products. Because she does not have enough initial capital, Guliton has decided to apply for a loan. With this money, she will buy food products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru:
Файзигул жительница района Хуросон вблизи городка Курган-Тюбе. Ей 58 лет. Она вдова. У нее есть четверо детей. Смысл ее жизни, ради них она живет и работает. У нее двое сыновей. Одному 22 года, другому 18 лет. Сын Файзигул служит в военных силах Таджикистана. Дочерям 22 года и 10 лет. Старшая дочь занимается шитьем национальной одежды. Она портниха. Младшую дочь Файзигул удочерила у родного брата. Так как у брата другая семья в другой стране и он живет со своей семьей. 10 летнюю дочь Файзигул обеспечивает во всем сама и даже перевела на свою фамилию. Дочь учится в школе. Она любит учиться.  
  Сама Файзигул в течение 12 лет занимается земледелием.  Она на скотном дворе выращивает крупнорогатых скотин.  Так как она занималась данным бизнесом только чтобы обеспечить семью. Файзигул на столь время набралась хорошего опыта работы и собирается расширить бизнес.  На данный момент у нее только один теленок. На заемные деньги она купит больше скотин и расширит деятельность и тем самым увеличится доходность, что поможет улучшить жизненные и финансовые условия семьи.
texts.en:
Fayzigul is a resident of the Khuroson District, close to the town of Kurgan-Tyube. She is 58 years old and a widow. She has three children. They are the reason for her life; she lives and works to benefit them. She has two sons. One is 22 years old, the other is 18 years old. Fayzigul's son serves in Tajikistan's military. Her daughters are 22 and 10 years old. Her eldest daughter, a seamstress, sews ethnic-style clothing. Her younger daughter attends school where she loves to learn.

For 12 years, Fayzigul has been practicing crop farming. She raises cattle in her barnyard. She runs this business only to provide for her family. In this time, she has accumulated a lot of good work experience and is planning to expand her business. She currently only has one calf. With the borrowed money, she will buy more young cows and expand her business. By doing so, she will increase her profitability which will improve the living and financial conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha is a 54-year-old married mother of four who has been running her convenience store for four years. Nouha's family's needs are increasing, and her other tailoring business which she runs from home, combined with her husband's income, aren't enough to cover these increasing needs. 

For this reason she though of acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special summer products that will increase her income and develop her family's standard of living.

She hopes to stay capable of supporting her business in a well-managed way to make sure she can cover most of her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special summer products

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita helps her husband in managing their own garden to earn a living. She has been in business for more than fourteen  years, and she has been able to provide for  the needs of the family. Her previous loan from GDMPC  used for farming  was successfully repaid. Finding ways to improve her farming activities, she took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue that is generated to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fredelie

texts.en:
Fredelie is 53 years old and widowed. She was gifted with only one child and they live in a rural community. To have additional income, she is engaged in a hog-raising business. She aims to acquire more pigs to raise but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. 

Being a hard-working mother, she believes that she will make more improvements in her business and hopes that someday, she will make it more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Saidbi

texts.ru: Сайдби 59 летняя жительница района Хуросон. Она мать троих детей. Ее дочерям 24 и 27 лет. Они занимаются растениеводством. Сайдби тоже работает в сфере сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она около 12 лет своей жизни посвятила кулей продажи крупно рогатых скотин. Сайдби обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить скотин для откорма и продажи. Она будет их кормит в течении длительного времени  и после продаст их с наценкой. Таким образом она приносит в дом доход. Сайдби очень надеется что ее поддержат и помогут ей купить пару голов скотин чтобы увеличить поголовья скота.
texts.en: Saidbi is a 59 year old resident of the Khuroson region, and is the mother of 3 children.  Her daughters are 24 and 27 years old, and both work in agriculture.  Saidbi also works in the field of agriculture.  She has dedicated nearly 12 years of her life to the buying and selling of long-horned cattle.  Saidbi is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to fatten and sell - she will feed them for a long time and then sell them for a profit.  In this way, she will be able to bring home income.  Saidbi greatly needs support and help to buy a pair of cattle to increase the number of livestock in her care.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and sell

loans.name: Dominar

texts.en:
Dominar is an entrepreneur who runs a retail store in the village, selling distilled water to make a living. For more than seven years, he has been earning well, with the help and support of his direct family members.

He needs to buy more bottled water to resell, in order to increase sales. With the microfinance loan of GDMPC, his plan was realized.

In the future, he wants to acquire a new unit of motorcycle, to be used for purposes of the business, in purchasing and carrying stock. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more bottled water to resell

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 28-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being visionary. 

Kennedy operates a retail business where he sells drinks. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be security. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of drinks. His business goal is to be the best within five years. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: buy more stocks of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zorayda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Zorayda works hard to support her family. She has a business selling feed in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.

Zorayda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more stocks of feed to resell.

Zorayda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of feed to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jhoy

texts.en:
Mary Jhoy is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell through her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Mary Jhoy has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Gyumri town with her husband and two children. She has been involved in a retail business for 10 years. She brings in supplies from a neighboring country two times a month. This business is very important for Anna's family to cover basic costs. 

Anna requested this loan to be able to request new stock of supplies and cover her customers' current orders. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of supplies for reselling to customers

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es: Estanislao tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su nieto de 11 años de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo. Estanislao solicita este crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava dado que desea encementar el piso del corredor de la vivienda que actualmente es de tierra. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Estanislao is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 11-year-old grandson. He works mainly in agriculture cultivating corn, beans, and sorghum. 

Estanislao is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand and gravel because he wants concrete flooring in the hallway of his home which is currently made of dirt. 

He hopes to have this financing and be able to begin with the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel because he wants concrete flooring in the hallway of his home.

loans.name: Marivi

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marivi works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from weaving nipa into roofing panels.

Marivi is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional fishing nets, for her fishing business.

Marivi has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 43 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. Leonisa works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, snack foods, and other groceries.

She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future Leonisa would like to save enough money to expand her business, and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Transito Dolores

texts.es:
Transito es soltera no tiene hijos vive los padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. 

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos. 

Transito se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz y papas ademas a la crianza de gallinas. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde, crianza para los animales.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. 

Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. El sueño es tener mas ingresos para comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando. Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Transito is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives with her parents in San Miguel in the Province of Bolivar. She belongs to the solidarity group Santiagueña, located in Santiago Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton, 15 minutes from the San Miguel office. This group has 12 members who work in agricultural activities such as sowing corn, beans and potatoes in addition to this they work in raising livestock such as laying hens and pigs. 

Transito works in agriculture sowing corn and potatoes as well as raising chickens. She needs a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure and balanced feed for fattening and raising the animals.  She does her shopping in the city of San Miguel and she sells at the market in San Miguel. 

She has encountered challenges such as pests and diseases in her crops. Her dream is to have more earnings and purchase a plot to continue working. She likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure as well as balanced feed for fattening and raising the animals.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hardworking man, with a retail shop and a tea plantation as his major business activities. He works 10 hours per day and 5 days a week. His customers are the tea traders and tea processors.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 (four millions shillings). He will use this amount to buy fertilizer and garden extension.

He is a hard-working man, with an additional business of coffee plantation. He is faced with the challenge of poor weather conditions, especially drought. However, he hopes to grow his businesses massively, become rich, and educate all his children for a better future, when given the loan money.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: José Macario

texts.es: José tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, una hija de 22 años, un hijo de 21  años de edad y un nieto de 3 años de edad. José es un hombre muy comprometido con su familia y además es muy conocido en su localidad  como un hombre responsable. Él se gana la vida  trabajando como agricultor y ganadero lo cual les permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia y mantener la economía del hogar. José desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, tela metálica, cemento, arena, piedra, grava y pago de mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en:
José, age 55, lives in his own house with his wife, a 22 year old daughter, a 21 year old son, and a three year old grandson.  José is a man who is very committed to his family.  He is also very well-known in his area as a responsible man.

He earns a living working in agriculture and with livestock.  This allows him to bring home daily sustenance to his family and to maintain the family finances.

José wishes to build a wall around the perimeter of his house.  In order to do so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy bricks, wire netting, cement, sand, rocks, and gravel and to pay for the construction labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José de 32 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos. José se dedica desde hace 15 años a la albañilería, es muy conocido en su comunidad por su responsabilidad y calidad en su trabajos. José está ampliando su vivienda, como se aprecia en la fotografía las paredes de una nueva habitación están a media altura. José quiere finalizar lo antes posible la construcción de esta habitación; por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava y los demás bloques de concreto que le hacen falta, polines y lámina galvanizada. José se ahorrará la mano de obra ya que él mismo realizará los trabajos.
texts.en:
José, age 32, lives with his life partner and their two children.  José has been working as a bricklayer for 15 years.  He is very well known in his community for being responsible and for the quality of his work.

José is expanding his house.  As can be seen in the photograph, the walls of a new room are at mid-height.  José wishes to build this room as soon as possible.  That is why he has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, the rest of the concrete blocks that he needs, purlins, and galvanized metal sheeting.  José will save the labor cost because he will do the jobs himself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new room to his house.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 57 years old and has six adult-age children. They live in a rural community and she manages a small retail store to supplement her husband's income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her store in order to earn a higher income. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, seasonings and beverages to sell. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, seasonings and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Glinis Guagdalupe

texts.es: La señora Glinis, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien labora como albañil tiene a su hijo estudiando, ella es comerciante de pulpería ubicado en su casa, desea mejorar las condiciones de la cocina en su hogar, con el crédito que solicita podrá comprar los materiales para poder empezar a realizar la división, y poder gozar de una cocina cómoda.
texts.en:
Glinis relies on her husband’s financial support, who works as a construction worker. Her son is studying. She is a storekeeper. The business is located in her house. She wishes to improve the conditions of her kitchen at home. 

She´ll be able to buy the materials to start  working on the partition with the loan she´s requesting. That way, she´ll be able to enjoy a comfortable kitchen.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Benita Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MILENIUM III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Benita tiene 69 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez realiza manualidades, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a sus negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos y cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank MILENIUM III, the bank is located in the area of Calca, province of Calca in Cusco. Benita is 69 years old and is married. This member alternates her daily activities with her business. She raises small animals to sell them later to her customers.

This member also does craft work. This member has been working in her business for a long time. She is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in her business every day. This member wishes to keep working so she can support her family.

This member is requesting the loan to buy food and guinea pigs for her business.This member is thankful for the granted loan and she is committed to pay her established fees.

loans.use: to buy food and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita operated her own sari sari (convenience) store for five years, earning well to add to her husband's income from farming. She earns well from this activity and was able to successfully repay her previous loans used for farming and her store. From her generated income, she had started a motorcycle transportation and rental service where the family member is the one to operate as tenant. She took a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy a helmet, raincoat, and accessories, She is hopeful to gain more profit and wants to improve her business to have a better income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a helmet, raincoat, and accessories

loans.name: Suzette Joy

texts.en:
Suzette Joy manages her own motor transport services business in her community, earning a good income for her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying new tires and accessories. Recently, she borrowed a new loan for additional motorcycle maintenance to ensure transportation safety.

In the future, she wants to expand her business to generate additional income for a better living.

loans.use: to pay for additional motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Purie

texts.en: Purie owns and operates a farm of fruit trees, bananas and coconut to make a living. She successfully manages it with the help of her husband. She became a member of GDMPC and gains access to microfinance services and recently requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate her farm to generate more income for a better future for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and planting materials.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a 45-year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells chicken. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the outbreak of poultry diseases. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of poultry. His business goal is to do large scale farming within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of poultry.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase paints, screens, shirts and other materials needed in her silk-screen printing business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting another PHP 60,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes to send all her children to college and dreams of a wider net and expansion of business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like paint, screens, and shirts for her printing business.

loans.name: Jeridah

texts.en: Jeridah is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she makes bricks to sell. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in the season. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to hire laborers to help in making bricks to sell. Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standard of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help in making bricks.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janice dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for items to resell at her store, including groceries, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and married with one child.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy spare parts for resale. However, due to increased demand, he needs more capital to stock more goods. In his business, he faces a problem of inadequate capital to purchase more stock. He dreams of educating his children, self-education, and moving his business to a more permanent location. John needs this loan to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Judith Marlene

texts.es:
Judith tiene 33 es soltera tiene dos hijos vive con los padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. 

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos. 

Judith se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz,papas y frejol, ademas a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Nesecita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde, crianza para los animales.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. 

Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. El sueño es seguir aumentando el negocio.  Le gusta mucho salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Judith is 33 years old and single with 2 children. She lives with her parents in San Miguel in Bolivar Province.

Judith belongs to the Santiago communal bank, located in Santiago Parish, San Miguel Canton, some 15 minutes from the  San Miguel office.  The communal bank has 12 members, all of whom are dedicated to agricultural activities such as sowing corn, beans, and potatoes. In addition, they raise farm animals such as laying hens and they fatten pigs. 

Judith is a farmer and she sows corn, potatoes, and beans, and also raises hens and pigs. She needs the loan to purchase fertilizers and manure plus feed for fattening and raising her animals. All purchases will be made in the city of San Miguel, and she will sell her products in the San Miguel Fair.

Judith has confronted challenges like plagues and illnesses in her crops. Her dream is to continue augmenting her business.  She especially enjoys taking long walks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and feed for her chickens and to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Doña Matilde, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a su esposo y tres de sus hijos. Ella Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia donde cultiva café, el cual vende despulpado y lavado en el mercado de la zona.  Ella esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 7,000 lempiras en forma grupal, para comprar fertilizantes para aplicar a la finca de café y así podrá sacar mejor cosecha. 
El grupo se llama Primavera, integrado de cuatro personas, que se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos y viven en la misma zona. El préstamo total del grupo es por 26,000 lempiras que lo invertirán en darle mantenimiento a sus fincas de café. En la foto se identifican así: doña Matilde a la izquierda, Rosa, Delmi y Alba a la derecha.
texts.en:
Matilde is 55 years old, married, and has 4 kids. She lives with her husband and 3 of her children in Gracias, Lempira. She has always dedicated herself to agriculture where she cultivates coffee with her family, that which she sells pulped and washed in the local market. She is requesting a second loan for 7,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers for the coffee farm in order to have a better harvest. 

The communal bank’s name is Primavera.  It is comprised of four people who grow basic grains and live in the same area.  The total amount of the group loan is for 26,000 lempiras.  They will use the loan to provide maintenance to their coffee farms.

In the photo Maltida is on the left followed by Rosa, then Delmi, and Alba is on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and leaf fertilizer to fertilize the coffee farm.

loans.name: Ivania Maria

texts.es: Es una señora amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 2 hijos, el mayor de 21 años cursa su quinto año de carrera universitaria y el menor de 5 años estudia su primer nivel de pre-escolar. Desde hace 13 años para poder acceder al servicio de agua, ha tenido que compartir pozo con su mama, sin embargo en la época de verano, existe escasez del vital liquido. Con el objetivo de construir su propio pozo artesanal, solicita su primer financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, bloque y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda con acceso a los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
She is a nice lady, from Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother with two kids. The older one is 21 years old and he is in his fifth year of college. The youngest, who is 5 years old, attends his first level of preschool. 

She has had to share the well with her mom for 13 years, to be able to have access to water service. However, in the summer time, there is a shortage of the vital liquid. She is requesting her first funding to build her own traditional well. She needs to buy the construction materials: cement, iron, cinder blocks, and to cover the labor cost. Her dream is to have a home with access to basic services.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, iron, cinder blocks, and to cover the labor cost.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie runs a retail store at home and has been in this business for many years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, for it gives better returns from her investments. Finding ways to improve sales, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods.

In the future, Tessie hopes to obtain a good return from this investment and acquire enough revolving funds for the business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell is a 45-year-old Kiva borrower. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells wet cell batteries and other hardware items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy and competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of wet cell batteries and other hardware items. 

His business goal is to have a big hardware business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of wet cell batteries and other hardware items.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantity and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

To be able to expand her inventory, Leonora is requesting another loan, this time for PHP 35,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leonora dreams of good health for every member of her family and hopes that her small variety store will soon become a grocery store. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Chanthoung's Group

texts.en: Chanthoung’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanthoung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en: Sarorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sarorn makes a living cultivating rice  and her family does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreyrath's Group

texts.en: Sreyrath’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sreyrath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ogla Betlania

texts.es:
La señora Ogla tiene 39  años de edad convive con su compañero de hogar tiene tres hijos que depende de su matrimonio y se dedica a la venta de maíz y leña que es su fuente principal de ingreso  cuenta con más de 2 años de realizarla dicha actividad económica la que le ha generado ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar, educación y crianza para sus hijos y cubrir gastos financieros.
Doña Ogla es una persona muy emprendedora, con el apoyo que solicita lo empleara en la compra de leña, maíz y frijoles y así tener suficiente materia prima  para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, lo que le generara mejores ingresos.
Doña Ogla uno de sus sueños  es mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia.

Trojes, Honduras – Abril  2014
texts.en:
Olga, 39, lives with her partner, has three children who depend on this union, and makes a living selling corn and firewood which is her principal source of income.  For over two years, she has been involved in this economic activity, which has generated sufficient income to cover household necessities; the education and upkeep of her children; and financial expenses. 

Olga is a very hard-working person.  She will use the support she is requesting to buy firewood, corn and beans and in that way have sufficient raw materials to satisfy the demands of her customers, which will generate better income for her.  

One of Olga's dreams is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Trojes, Honduras – April  2014

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and beans for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Despite being widowed, Maria has the determination to uplift the living status of her family. She is 58 years old and has five adult-age children. 

She aims to improve her small retail store and increase her income, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy beverages, breads, seasonings, laundry soaps, soft drinks and canned goods to sell. 

Through this loan, she believes that she will improve her business more.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, seasonings, laundry soaps, soft drinks and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yen, of the Thai ethnic people, was born in 1975. Her family has 4 members includes her husband, her and the two children (one son and one daughter) are both obedient. Her eldest son just has got married and her family is waiting for a new member from the young new married couple. Her daughter is at the first year at Son La College of Pedagogy.

The main income of her family is primarily based on breeding and farming. With this income, it is just enough for her family spending at limited level and it is very difficult if there is arising matter with big cost. So, her daughter is studying far away from home for the first year is a great joy but includes many anxieties on her daughter studying costs.

Therefore, she needs to borrow a loan to cover her daughter tuition costs. Her family hopes that this loan can somewhat assure her daughter feels peace at her mind for studying in order to become a good teacher in future to teach their lovely people at her countryside.

loans.use: to cover her daughter tuition costs

loans.name: Rofemie

texts.en:
Rofemie is married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works in the government, and she helps him by managing their farm. 

In order to cover the costs of fertilization and weeding maintenance, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit, where she had joined currently. 

She hopes to gain more harvest in order to send her child to school and be able to improve the general living of the family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of fertilization and weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina tiene 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y con sus tres hijos (una niña de 6, dos niños de 13 y 14 años de edad). Reina trabaja como empleada domestica, labor que realiza desde hace 10 años, su esposo es empleado de una fabrica. La vivienda de Reina es muy humilde con madera rolliza como estructura principal y las paredes son de adobe que algunas áreas no están repelladas. Reina quiere mejorar todas las paredes de su vivienda por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento y arena para repellar y afinar todas las paredes, también comprar pintura para dar mejor apariencia. Reina está consiente de pagar en el tiempo estipulado las cuotas del crédito y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida saldará este compromiso.
texts.en: Reina is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and three children (a six-year-old daughter, and two sons of 13 and 14 years of age). Reina works as a domestic worker. She has been doing this for ten years. Her husband is employed at a factory. Reina’s home is very humble with a wooden structure and adobe walls which are not plastered in some places.  Reina wants to improve all the walls of her home, which is why she has requested a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement and sand to plaster and apply a finish coat to all the walls. She will also buy paint to give them a better appearance. Reina agrees to make her repayments within the stipulated time period and she will pay off the loan with the help of her partner.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster and finish the walls of her home. She will also buy paint for painting the walls.

loans.name: Hendry Adrian

texts.es:
Hendry tiene 23 es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. 

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos. 

Hendry se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz,papas y frejol, ademas a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Nesecita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde, crianza para los animales.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. 

Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. El sueño es seguir aumentando el negocio.  Le gusta mucho hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Hendry is 23 years old, single, and childless. He lives with his parents in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. He belongs to the communal bank “Santiagueña”, which is located in the parish of Santiago in the canton of San Miguel, 15 minutes away from the San Miguel office. There are 12 members in this communal bank and they make a living from farming activities, such as planting maize, beans, and potatoes; raising animals, such as laying hens; and fattening pigs.

Hendry makes a living from agriculture – from planting maize, potatoes, and beans, and from raising hens and pigs. He needs the loan in order to buy fertilisers, compost, and animal feed. He makes his purchases in the city of San Miguel and he sells his products at the fair in San Miguel.

He has faced challenges, such as pests and crop diseases. His dream is to continue growing his business. He really likes playing sport.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, compost, and animal feed

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Felix de 46 años vive en casa propia con su esposa han procreado tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Felix se ha dedicado desde hace 22 años a trabajar como albañil y hoy está supervisando un proyecto de construcción de muro de contención en una comunidad fuera de su municipio. Felix está entusiasmado con la construcción de su vivienda que poco a poco ha ido levantado y que le hace falta comprar las ventanas, defensas de ventanas, dos puertas y la cerámica del piso. Pero Felix no cuenta con todo el monto para la compra e instalación de estos materiales ya que tuvo que hacer unos gastos imprevistos para su hogar. Por lo anterior Felix solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar las ventanas y defensas, 2 puertas, cemento y cerámica para finalizar su vivienda.
texts.en: 46-year-old Felix lives in his own house with his wife. They have three children, who are now adults. For 22 years, Felix has worked as a construction worker and he is now supervising a construction project consisting of building a retaining wall in a community outside his municipality. Felix is enthusiastic about building his home, which has been built little by little. He still needs to buy windows, window bars, two doors, and ceramic floor tiles. But Felix does not have the total amount he needs to buy and install these materials since he had some unexpected expenses for his house. For this reason, Felix is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy the windows and window bars, two doors, cement, and floor tiles so he can finish his home.

loans.use: to buy windows, window bars, two doors, cement, and floor tiles to finish his home

loans.name: Monica Yanira

texts.es: Mónica de 43 años tiene tres hijos de 12, 16 y 19 años de edad. Su esposo es empleado de una empresa de productos químicos. María tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de antojitos (Tostadas de Plátano y chicharrón, yuca frita y otros). María y su familia han vivido en casa propia por 15 años pero no han tenido el servicio de luz eléctrica. Mónica se ha hacercado a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito y con el dinero comprar todos los materiales necesarios para la instalación de la red eléctrica en su vivienda y solicitar la conexión a la compañía eléctrica de la zona. Mónica tendrá el apoyo de su esposo y de su hijo mayor (que ya está trabajando en un puesto de comida rápida) para cancelar todas las cuotas de este crédito.
texts.en:
Mónica is 43 years old and has three children aged 12, 16 and 19.  Her husband works for a company that makes chemical products.  For the last 20 years she has had a business selling snacks such as fried bananas, as well as fried pork and yucca.

She and her family have lived in their own home for 15 years but have not had electricity.  Mónica has approached FUSAI to seek a loan.  She will use the funds to purchase all the necessary materials to install electrical wiring to her home, and to establish a connection to the local electricity company. She will have the support of her husband and her eldest son (who is already working selling fast food) to make all her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to purchase all the necessary materials to install electrical wiring to her home, and to establish a connection to the local electricity company.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad vive con sus 4 hijos (22, 18,16 y 13 años de edad) en casa propia. Su esposo tuvo que emigrar a otro país, por lo que Ana ha hecho un mayor esfuerzo para la educación y el cuido de sus 4 hijos. Ana tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de tambos de gas propano (recipiente con gas propano para uso del hogar). Ana a solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para construir 2 columnas de concreto y ampliar el techo de un corredor de su vivienda, con el dinero comprará Cemento, hierro, arena, grava, polín triangular y lámina galvanizada. Ana menciona que cumplirá con el pago de las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and lives at home with her ​​four children ages 13,16,18, and 22. Her husband had to emigrate to another country, so Ana has made a major effort to provide care and an education for her four children. She has been selling propane gas containers for home use for 20 years. Ana has requested a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, iron, sand, gravel, triangular cord, and galvanized sheets to construct two concrete columns and extend a hallway roof in her home. Ana agrees to comply with the repayment of the loan fees.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, gravel, triangular cord, and galvanized sheets to construct two concrete columns and extend a hallway roof in her home.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad habita en casa propia al lado de su esposo y dos hijos adolescentes. María ha instalado en su vivienda una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta básica como; azúcar, arroz, frijoles además vende diferente tipo de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas. Con la ganancia de sus ventas, María ha podido salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil. María ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para continuar con la construcción de un muro de contención (en la fotografía se ve el avance del muro), para eso necesita comprar bloque de concreto, cemento, hierro, arena y grava. Al finalizar la construcción del muro evitará que el terreno de su propiedad se siga erosionando, además ganará más espacio que podrá ocupar para futura ampliación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 46 and lives in her own home along with her husband and two adolescent children.  She has installed in her home a small grocery shop where she sells items such as sugar, rice, and beans, as well as different types of candies and sodas.  With the earnings from her sales, she has been able to get ahead and support her husband who works as a bricklayer.

She has sought a loan through FUSAI in order to continue the construction of a retaining wall. (The photo shows her progress so far.)
