In order to do this she needs to purchase concrete blocks, cement, steel, sand and gravel.  Once the wall is finished, it will keep her property from continuing to erode.  It will also give her more room to allow for future expansion of her shop.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, cement, steel, sand and gravel to continue building her retaining wall.

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  HORONYA ont en moyenne 51ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe HORONYA sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. CHATA 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60Kg d’arachide, 50Kg d’haricot et 50Kg de riz. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who make up the HORONYA group are, on average, 51 years old and they also have an average of five children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in Bla / Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

These women know one another through family ties and are involved in such activities as buying and selling condiments, grains, and other various goods.  They are taking a third solidarity loan and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Chata, standing first from the right in the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 60 kilos of groundnuts, 50 kilos of beans and 50 kilos of rice.  She buys her goods locally.  She resells to both men and women who pay her in cash but also often on credit.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will be used to take care of some health-related expenses and to pay school fees, while the rest of the money will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Marivic would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Marivic's profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic hopes to become successful in business and in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kisa Kya Mukama Group

texts.en:
The Kisa Kya Mukama Group, located in a rural area, is comprised of five women: Sarah, Rashidah, Madrine, Jane and Agnes. Their businesses include textiles, retail shops, matooke trading and farming.

Sarah is a single mother with 3 children, all attending school. Since 2004, she has operated a matooke (a variety of cooking banana) business and she also does agriculture as a side business. Sarah works 7 days a week and 15 hours per day. Her clients are the local residents since her capital is quite small. Sarah started the business to get school fees for her children. She has acquired a loan to boost her business (buying additional stock of bananas to resell). She hopes this will increase her profits and income base. 

Sarah's hope for the future is to build some rentals for her children. Her business challenge is the poor infrastructure, especially roads, which incurs high costs to transport matooke to the market. Sarah describes herself as a hardworking woman appreciating the work of lenders.

loans.use: To buy bananas to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Wilbert Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilbert, es padre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes tiene bajo su cargo, el mantiene sus gastos gracias a su actividad comercial la venta de uniformes médicos por encargo. Wilbert solicita el crédito para apoyarse contando con el efectivo y poder comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un cuarto en su vivienda  que le permitirá brindar su propio espacio y privacidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilbert is the father of two young children who he has in his care.  He manages his expenses thanks to his work selling medical uniforms by order.  

Wilbert is requesting this loan to help with cash flow and to be able to purchase construction materials to build a room on his house.  This will allow him to have his own space and privacy from his children.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, iron, roof beams, and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Adrian es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. El se dedica a la venta de  cerdos desde hace unos años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación y lugares aledaños  en el municipio donde vive.
Don Adrian necesita el préstamo para la compra de más cerdos y concentrado para seguir sustentándolos, y así seguir realizando su negocio; el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
Don Adrian con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por ellos a diario, y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
El espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para  tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del  2014
texts.en:
Adrian is a hard-working, responsible and humble person who lives together with his family in a community in the south of Honduras. He has been selling pigs for the past few years. He works from his house and in the neighboring communities in his municipality.

Adrian needs the loan to buy more pigs and concentrated feed to sustain them. Then he can continue running his business which generates most of his income. Adrian hopes with the loan to increase his sales considerably and this will help him a lot as now he does not have the products that his clients are demanding from him each day.

Thanks to this he could improve his family's quality of living with the increase of revenue into his home. He hopes in the short term to expand his business and doing this continue to support his family and provide his children with the education they need to have better opportunities in life. Choluteca, Honduras - April 2014.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and concentrated feed for his business.

loans.name: Lucy Yerica

texts.es:
Lucy vive en la ciudad de Nazca, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro inicair su negocio de peluquería, ya que anteriormente trabajaba para varias peluquerias de su ciudad, actualmente tiene su negocio frente al mercado de su ciudad con lo cual siempre tiene clientes que visitan su local, sobre todo los fines de semana.

Luxcy esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una silla infantil, para poder realizar los cortes a niños pequeños y también podrá  comprar e instalar un panel publicitario para su local, de esta manera podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder promocionar su negocio, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá esforzándose para poder realizar su gran sueño:” tener una boutique y poder darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Lucy lives in the city of Nazca.  She is a young person with a desire to succeed, which is why with a lot of effort and savings, she was able to start her beauty salon.  Previously, she worked for various salons in the city, and now she has a business in front of the market in the city, so she always has customers who visit her salon, especially on the weekends.

Lucy is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their support she will be able to purchase a child's seat so she can give young children haircuts and also purchase and install an advertising panel.  These will allow her to give her customers better service and be able to promote her business.  She will improve her income and continue making an effort to be able to achieve her dream of having a boutique and be able to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a seat for child's haircuts and an advertising panel.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años de edad es propietario de un taller de soldadura que se encuentra ubicado al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad. En su negocio se dedica a la reparación y mantenimientos de camiones vehículos y otros. Su idea de negocio nació hace 10 años cuando observaba en el sector donde habita un importantes número de camiones de maquinarias pesadas y diversos vehículos dedicados al transporte de cargas y de materiales para construcción, que se ubicaban en el local de su madre que le servían parqueo para hacer trabajos de mantenimiento. Poco a poco se fue involucrando, puso un aviso publicitario y ubicó su propio taller en el local de su madre y empezó a repara vehículos, como volquetas, camiones pesados etc. 
Su meta es lograr adecuaciones al local, ponerle cubierta para proteger los vehículos y las personas de la lluvia, pues su sueño y gran desafío es educar profesionalmente  a sus hijos, pues su negocio es el único generador de ingresos de su hogar. En la actualidad  Carlos está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  soldadura autógena y un equipo de soldar de mayor capacidad y hará mejoras locativas al negocio.
texts.en:
58 year old Carlos is the owner of a welding shop located south of the city, where he lives with his wife and his two young children. In his business he works in repair and maintenance of trucks and other vehicles. His business idea began 10 years ago when he noticed that in the area where he lives there were a significant number of heavy machinery trucks and various vehicles used for the transport of cargo and construction materials. These vehicles were located at his mother´s place which he used to park the cars to do his maintenance jobs. Little by little he got involved. He posted an advertisement, set up his own shop at his mother´s place, and started repairing vehicles such as dump trucks, heavy trucks, etc.

His goal is to make changes to the place, to cover it to protect the vehicles and people from rain, since his dream and big challenge is educating his children professionally, and his business is the only income generator for the household. Currently Carlos is applying for a credikiva. It is his first financial request that he has made to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which he will buy welding equipment and a welding machine with greater capacity, and will make improvements to the business.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment and a welding machine with greater capacity, and to make improvements to his business

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati lives in Mahabbatnagar village, West Bengal. She studied only up to second grade. She is married and has a son who has completed his 12th grade and is about to start his higher education. The family   cultivates betel leaves and earns around 70,000 INR per year which is not adequate for their needs. 

Arati wants to increase her cultivation for which she is requesting a loan to buy more wood, bamboo, straw, fertilizer, and saplings and pay for labor. She is a member of “Mahamaya” Self-Help Group. 

Arati hopes for a good harvest with which she will be able to manage household expenses and help her son for his higher education. She dreams of owning a bigger betel leaf farm.

loans.use: to buy more wood, bamboo, straw, fertilizer, and saplings and pay for labor  for betel cultivation

loans.name: Manimala Self-Help Group-2

texts.en:
The members belong to the "Manimala" Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Mahabbatnagar, West Bengal. This group is managed by the local NGO called “Sabuj Sangh”. Shanta (hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. 

Shanta is 48 years old, married, and has two sons and a daughter. She lives with her spouse. All three children are B.A. graduates. She spends most of her time alternating between her daily tasks and cultivation of paddy (rice) in her small cultivable land. She has been into this business for years and puts in a lot of effort every day. She is a hardworking and responsible person. 

Shanta is requesting a loan to purchase some more cultivable land, which will help her in cultivation of paddy (rice).

The other members need the loan for paddy cultivation and for pond digging.

loans.use: to purchase some cultivable land

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Gladys se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora del jardín de niños, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueno de la socia es tener su propio jardin.La socia solicita el crédito para pagar la educación de su hijos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Gladys continues her work as a teacher at a preschool. She works from 8 am until 2 pm. She wants to get ahead through her work. Her dream is to own her own preschool. Gladys is requesting a loan to pay for the education of her children. She thanks all those who form part of this dream through this loan. She promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Edwin Raul

texts.es:
Edwin vive en la ciudad de nazca, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo trabaja día a día en su negocio de taller mecánico desde hace 6 años, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder apoyar a su familia.

Edwin esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una lavadora para su madre, con lo cual podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre y darle sobre todo tranquilidad; así podrá seguir trabajando y estudiando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un taller más grande”.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in the city of Nazca. He is a young man with a lot of desire to get ahead. Because of this he has been putting in a lot of effort every day for the past 6 years in his car repair shop. This provides the money to get ahead and be able to support his family.

Edwin is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they offer he can buy a clothes washing machine for his mother. This will improve her quality of living and bring her a bit of peace of mind. Then he can continue to work and study to achieve his big dream which is to have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Manideepa Self-Help Group-2

texts.en:
Anima, 38, is married and has three daughters and a son. Two of her daughters are married while the younger daughter and son are studying in school. She has poultry farm where she raises and sells chickens and eggs. Regardless of her considerable efforts, she faces difficulties including the high price of supplies, the low price of their products, and insect issues.

Anima is a member of “Manideepa” Self-Help Group managed by the local NGO ‘Sabuj Sangh’ where she got trained in livelihood activities which helped her to avoid the damages caused by insects. She also got help in pricing of products and supplies.

Anima will use the loan amount to buy chickens along with their medicines, food and a hatching house. She hopes this will expand her business. Anima wants to save enough money for her children’s education. She wants to be an independent and successful woman.  

In the picture Anima has raised her hand. The other two members are requesting a loan for betel vine cultivation and to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas de San Lorenzo está en su ciclo número 7, ellas además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rogelia, que además es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, empieza su día desde muy temprano, ya que va a buscar siempre productos frescos al mercado para surtir su negocio.
Hoy ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos varios para la venta, como ser verduras, carne, bebidas, frutas y demás.
texts.en:
The group known as "Mujeres Unidas de San Lorenzo" is in their 7th cycle. They are also participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey on the elimination of poverty to understand the situation of each member and from this understand how to grow and progress.

One of the members is Rogelia who is also the president of the group. She is a hard-working person. She starts her day very early as she always has to find fresh products at the market to stock her business. Today she is requesting a loan to buy products to sell like vegetables, meats, drinks, fruit and others.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, drinks, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes, la socia tiene varios anos en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia sigue trabajando como docente,el sueno de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar autopartes como parabrisas y faroles.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en: Beatriz continues with her business of selling auto parts. She has been running her business for a number of years and things are going well for her. She also continues to work as a teacher. Her dream is to expand her business selling auto parts. She is requesting the loan to buy auto parts like windshield wipers and lights. She promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy auto parts like windshield wipers and lights.

loans.name: Jovit

texts.en:
Jovit has owned and operated a business raising pigs for sale for more than three years. He also has a farm that gives him good income aside from his salary from employment. 

In 2011, Jovit joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He successfully repaid his previous loans used for these activities for he got good returns from his investments. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer to improve his farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Careyl

texts.en: Careyl  operates a transportation business for a living. After three years of running her transportation business, Careyl is happy to say that this helps her family a lot while awaiting the harvest from their crops. She has been able to sustain the business  and has plans to improve the services. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy new tires to replace the old ones and accessories like helmets and raincoats. In the future, she wants to have a better standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace the old ones and accessories like helmets and raincoats

loans.name: Hellen Lizeth

texts.es:
Hellen vive en la ciudad de Nazca, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como enfermera en una botica de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

Hellen agradece el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar electrodomésticos para su vivienda como cocina, entre otros; de esta manera irá mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propia botica”.
texts.en:
Hellen lives in the city of Nazca. She is a young woman who is very eager to succeed. She works as a nurse at a drugstore in her city, which allows her to have an income in order to move forward and support her family with household expenses. 

Hellen gives thanks for the support that she has received. She will be able to buy appliances for her house like a stove, among others. In this way she will begin improving her quality of life and continue fighting to fulfill her ultimate dream: "To have her own drugstore."

loans.use: to buy appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Sagarika Self Help Group-2

texts.en:
Malati is 35 years old and studied as far as fifth grade. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her daughter is studying in 10th grade and her son is in 8th grade. Her husband has a salon and even Malati helps him in business. Her family’s annual income is around 30,000 INR; it’s their only source of income. 

The income isn't sufficient for their family needs. Hence Malati plans to improve the salon with better equipment for which she is requesting a loan to provide better services to the customers. Her dream is to have a big salon with modern equipment.  

Malati belongs to a Self-Help Group called “Sagarika” which is undertaken by the local NGO “Sabuj Sangh”. The other three members will use their portion for poultry farming, vegetable cultivation and for paddy (rice) cultivation. Malati is the featured borrower of this group. This loan will help all of them in securing a better life and giving good education to their children.

loans.use: to buy equipment for the salon

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to make a living. She established the business as a way of generating extra income and earn more to meet their needs. 

She has been engaged in this type of service for more than three years, was able to sustain it, and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for motorcycle spare parts. 

Recently she took a new loan to buy new tires to replace the old ones.

In the future, she wants to purchase more units of motorcycles to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace the old ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a mother of three residing in Nairobi.

She runs a small business dealing in second-hand clothes in one of the city's markets. She recently learned about Fresh Life Toilets and thought it would be wise to try out the franchise. She identified the opportunity after speaking to one of the people who owns a franchise and was impressed by the income the franchise enables the owner to generate.

She is seeking a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets. The two toilets would be set up in an area with high human traffic but limited sanitation facilities. She hopes that her new business will generate enough income to help her repay her loan as well as improve sanitation standards in the area.

loans.use: To purchase and manage two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Maracana Poty Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas están en su segundo ciclo del programa de comités, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y que gracias a su negocio está ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar más prendas, especialmente de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere poder tener buena variedad que dar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are 17 women in this group, and they are in their second group loan cycle. They are also participating in the poverty elimination survey, in order to improve their livelihoods. 

One of the group members is Maria, who sells a variety of clothing items. Thanks to her business, Maria is helping her family and her dear ones. She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of additional clothing items, especially winter clothes, because winter is approaching and she wants to have a variety of items to provide to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase winter garmens to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina operates their farm and at the same time runs a retail store to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. With the income she generates from these activities, she has been able to successfully repay her previous loans.

Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase fertilizers to improve the farm. She hopes to generate more income in order to pay for their daily needs and to be able to save a portion of her profits for future needs.

loans.use: to improve her farm by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en:
Lodgenia's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Recently she expanded, and has cultivated an additional lot. 

She used her previous loan for the financial needs of her farming, and had successfully repaid it since she had a good return from her investment. 

Recently she borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds for the next planting season. 

Lodgenia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik lives in Artik town with her parents and brother. She is a teacher working at a local school. 

Besides her work at school, Nazik also provides classes at her house. She currently has two groups, each with 10 students. Nazik is very careful and a nice teacher for her students; she does her best to provide appropriate conditions for studying. 

The requested loan is very important for Nazik to be able to purchase chairs and a table needed for her work room. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this hardworking woman with her loan.

loans.use: to pay for chairs and a table for her work room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing assorted goods, including cigarettes, drinks, and biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional goods, such as eggs, drinks, and biscuits

loans.name: Adrian Jose

texts.es: Adrián es un humilde y pujante trabajador que se ha atendido durante tres años una cafetería a la cual le paga el arriendo, convirtiéndose este local en una meta a cumplir pues quiere adquirirlo y poder trabajarlo y modificarlo a su propio gusto, su actividad la aprendió empíricamente y surge ante la necesidad de mantener a su pareja y dos hijos en unas buenas condiciones tanto saludables, locativas, educativas entre otras. Adrián solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de frituras y gaseosas ya que trabajara más tiempo en la cafetería con el fin de recoger el capital suficiente para adquirir el local y mejorar su situación económica y sabe que este crédito es la ayuda propicia para ejecutar tales proyectos
texts.en:
Adrián is a humble and hardworking man. For three years he has taken care of a snack bar, for which he pays renting. His goal is to acquire this business, keep working there and modified it as he sees fit.

He learned about this business in an empirical way, and it all started because of the need of supporting his life partner and two children. He wanted to keep giving them good health conditions, proper education and a good place to live, among others. 

Adrián is requesting a loan to buy goods, like fried snacks and soda pops. He will be working more hours in the snack bar with the objective of having enough capital to acquire the property, and improve his financial situation. He knows this loan is the right help to execute his projects.

loans.use: to buy goods, like: fried snacks and soda pops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies to assist and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Guarani Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Guarani está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene todas las esperanzas puestas en mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo de todas.
Maria es una de las integrantes, ella vende frutas y verduras, y pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras frescas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por sus seres queridos, para que ellos tengan todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group named Guarani is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. It is a new group that has set all its hopes on improving their living conditions through the work of all the women. 

Maria is one of the group members. She sells fruits and vegetables and is requesting this loan to buy fresh vegetables so she can continue selling as she has been doing. 

Maria is a hard-working person who strives so her loved ones can have everything she couldn't have. She appreciates this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Christian Emil

texts.es:
Cristian un joven luchador que con solo 20 años ya es cabeza de hogar, formo una familia a muy temprana edad tenía 16 años cuando comenzó una relación en unión libre, nos comenta Christian que de esa hermosa relación nació su pequeño hijo que hoy ya está en sus 4 años, Christian tuvo que luchar muy duro para salir adelante y no quedarse sin preparación, el tubo varios trabajos con un sueldo no muy bueno pero el mismo que les ayudo a terminar sus estudios ellos con un gran esfuerzo lograron obtener el bachillerato y poder obtener mayores oportunidades de trabajo. 
Siempre tuvieron la ilusión de tener un negocio y hoy luego de muchos sacrificios y mucho esfuerzo tienen las posibilidades y la oportunidad de emprender en su propio negocio, y acudieron a Fundación Alternativa con la esperanza de recibir el apoyo, para realizar su sueño, 
Ellos emprenderán su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos en el mismo que nacieron y crecieron, este Cantón tiene mucho movimiento comercial debido a la gran cantidad de turistas nacionales y extranjeros que siempre están de visita a disfrutar de las maravillosas cascadas y hostería que disponemos en el mismo. 
Con esta inversión mejorarán los ingresos económicos y les ayudará a darle a su hijos todo lo que necesita para iniciar su preparación, Christian  agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva  por la acogida y la gran ayuda que le están brindando a él y su familia.
texts.en:
Christian is a young fighter who at just 20 years of age is already a head of household. He started a family very early; he was 16 years old when he entered into a common law marriage. Christian tells us that his little boy, who is now 4 years old, was born from that beautiful relationship. Christian had to fight very hard to move forward and not to be unprepared. He had various jobs with not very good salaries, but he himself helped them finish their studies. With great effort they were able to obtain high school diplomas and better job opportunities.

They have always had a dream of having a business. Today, after many sacrifices and great efforts, they have the possibility and the opportunity to start their own business. They looked to Fundacion Alternativa with the hope of receiving support to fulfill their dream. They will start their business selling clothes and shoes in the canton San Miguel de los Bancos, the same one in which they were born and raised. This canton has a lot of commercial activity as a result of the great number of national tourists and foreigners that are always visiting to enjoy the wonderful waterfalls and hostels that are available there.

With this loan they will improve their income, and it will help them give their child all that he needs to begin his preparation. Christian gives thanks to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for the welcome and for the great help that they are providing for him and his family.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Katupyry Group

texts.es:
En el grupo Emprendedoras Katupyry son mujeres activas que se empeñan en progresar para el logro de una mejor calidad de vida, tiene en total 25 mujeres trabajadoras, donde  el deseo de cada una de ellas es trabajar, tienen muchas perspectivas con ideas y metas de mejorar.
Maria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y que por medio de eso está ayudando a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para sus comestibles, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma poder ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The women of the group "Katupyry Entrepreneurs" are active women, who are determined to make progress towards attaining a better quality of life. The group is composed of 25 entrepreneurial women, each of whom desires to work hard. They have a variety of perspectives and ideas and goals to improve.

Maria is one of the group members. She sells food which she prepares herself, and then goes out to sell on foot. She says it is very demanding work, but through it she is helping her family. She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of supplies for her food, such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and more. This will enable her to continue with her work as she has done, and in this way she will be helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken and additional supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma owned and operated a retail business in the local community to earn a living.  She has been doing this for more than seven years. With her income, she was able to successfully repay her previous loan and finance her farm. She needs farm improvements and, because of this, took out a new loan from GDMPC micro credit.  She will use the loan to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Gyumri town with her two sons. Gayane's eldest son is an army officer and is rarely at home, whereas her other son is a student. Her husband migrated last year with the hope of finding a well-paid job. Gayane herself is involved in the retail business. A teacher by profession, Gayane has been involved in souvenir sales for over seven years. In a small, rented store near the center of the city, Gayane trades different types of souvenirs, accessories and candles. 

She needs this requested loan to be able to acquire new supplies of stock for her store. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new supplies of stock for her store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is married with five children. She owns and operates a retail store selling grocery products in their village, and earning well for a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods for sale. Finding ways to improve sales, she took a new loan to acquire additional grocery goods. She hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income for the family and for a better future.

loans.use: to acquire additional grocery goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more fish ( foo-foo) and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses. As a result, she initiated her business selling animals. She buys baby goats and, after raising them for a year or two, sells them locally with the support of her husband. She has gradually improved her business by taking loans from Kashf Foundation.

She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help to provide her more income.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Klara Grace

texts.en:
Klara Grace is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in HRM. She is studying at Misamis University, Ozamiz City. She is single and lives with her family. Her parents worked as bookkeepers. She was determined and wants to finish her studies to have a bright future of her own.

She is thankful to GDMPC, as they give every student a chance to continue studying. Their services are specialized for students. She recently took a new loan to pay for the school tuition fees for the first semester of this year. She hopes to be successful and be able to have a nice job as the result of her untiring effort.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli lives in Gyumri town with her son. Her eldest son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Nelli has been involved in the retail business for two years. She trades different types of home supplies and baby care products from her house. During the weekends, Nelli also takes products to nearby villages and sells there. 

The requested loan is very important for Nelli to purchase new stock of supplies (home supplies, baby care) for reselling to her customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Nelli hopes for lenders' support and goodwill to her retail business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies (home supplies, baby care) for reselling to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sardines and slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is running a business selling milk for many years. She has two cows and one buffalo. She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk while her husband sells locally on daily basis. Shameem has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and she makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Shameem is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
At the age 37, Ghulam Fatima is a hardworking, married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a nurse with six years of experience. She works at a local clinic and also provides personal medical service to her neighbors in the town. She lives in Masis town with her daughter and two grandchildren, who are attending kindergarten. Karine has requested financial support to purchase tools and medical equipment so that she can provide medical services. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help Karine to continue her work and to provide better medical care to her clients.

loans.use: to pay for tools and medical equipment.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 43-year-old married woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, then sews and sells it to the local people. She always has a great product selection to offer.  She also earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Nusrat has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and colored spools of thread. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Nusrat’s 8th loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and colored spools of thread.

loans.name: Boymuhammad

texts.ru:
Боймухаммад имеет среднее образование. Он работает мастером по ремонту домов в течение 8 лет. Боймухаммад родом из района Вахш. Он женат и является отцом двух дочерей и сына. Дочерям по 18 и 10 лет, а сыну 12 лет. Старшая его дочь студентка Государственного Университета города Кургантюбе, факультета "Дошкольной педагогики и психологии". Она прилежная студентка и с интересом учит свои основные предметы. А младшая дочь и сын еще учатся в школе. Жена Боймухаммада преподает в школе. 
Сейчас семья Боймухаммада нуждается в 400 долларах США и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Из запрашиваемой суммы 300 долларов пойдут на оплату учебы дочери в университете, а на 100 долларов он купит дочери необходимые учебные принадлежности. Этот кредит сейчас им очень нужен. Боймухаммад надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Boymuhammad has a high school education. He has worked as a master repairman of houses for eight years. Boymuhammad comes from the region of Vakhsh. He is married and the father of two daughters and a son. His daughters are 18 and 10 years old, and his son is 12 years old. His older daughter is a student at the State University of Kurgan for Preschool Pedagogy and Psychology.  She works hard as a student and has interest in teaching the core subjects. His youngest daughter and son are still in school. Boymuhammad's wife teaches at school. Now Boymuhammad's family needs $400 American Dollars and for this reason he applied for a loan. From this amount $300 dollars will be spent on sending his daughter to University, and $100 dollars will buy his daughter the necessary school supplies. They need this loan very much. Boymuhammad hopes for your support.

loans.use: Purchase tuition for his daughter and partly to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Umoja Mulitipurpose Dev't Association Group

texts.en: Maimuna (raising hand) is a 52-year-old married woman with six children.  She lives  in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She sells cocoa alongside food items such as beans, cassava flour, and pancakes. She has been in this business since 1989 and she uses the income to address her family's needs.  She dreams of increasing her business to a big store of cocoa. Maimuna intends to use the loan to buy  cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a food container, pot, and slipper.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 42-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the local people. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

Kaneez requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of cloth for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a quality education to her children through her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 42-year-old, married woman with 6 children. She has been weaving sweaters for the past six years. She works hard on her weaver every day so that she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education.

Parveen is requesting her 5th loan from Kashf Foundation in the amount of 40,000 PKR. She will use it to purchase spools of wool and threads in different colors along with the packs of needles. She hopes to increase her earnings. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool and threads in different colors along with the packs of needles.

loans.name: Humaria

texts.en:
Humaria is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been selling bangles for many years. She buys bangles from wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community for a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family's needs. Therefore, she started her own business to contribute to the family income.

Humaria has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 44-year-old married woman with 7 children between the ages of 19 and 25 years old.  She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a developing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. She hopes that the business will be successful in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 40-year-old married lady who is running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 40,000 PKR to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 43-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys small animals at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a PKR 40,000 loan to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 41-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. Two of her daughters also assist her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she has the best earnings in her household.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials. This includes thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en: Sania is a 21-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат юная жительница района Кубадиён. Ей 20. Она недавно окончила школу. Малохат живет с родителями. Она не замужем. Малохат родилась там, где в округе основным источником дохода является для населения сельскохозяйственные деятельности. Малохат не стала исключением и тоже выбрала данную деятельность. Она ранее помогала родителям на скотном дворе, но сейчас ей 20 лет и она набралась достаточного опыта, чтобы содержать скотин самостоятельно. Малохат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить телят для откорма и продажи.
texts.en: Malohat is a young resident of the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  She is 20 years old and finished school not long ago.  She is not married and still lives with her parents.  She was born in a part of the country where farming constitutes the main source of income for the local population.  Malohat decided not to be an exception and also chose to work in this field.  She used to help her parents take care of their livestock, but now that she is 20 years old, she has accumulated enough experience to have her own livestock.  She is seeking a loan to buy a few calves for fattening and resale.

loans.use: to buy some calves.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 35 years old and lives in Chililabombwe with his wife and one-year-old son. He has been operating his Zoona mobile money business for three years now. His business provides financial services to people in his community by utilizing mobile technology. The business is his main source of income. Currently, he employs six young people in his community to help him in the day-to-day operations of the business.

Edson would like to take this opportunity to thank his lenders for helping him to grow the business. He has accessed three Kiva loans thus far and successfully paid back two. He continues to pay back his third loan on time. The previous loans allowed him to add new products to his business. He also has been able to grow the business by opening two more outlets in his home town of Chililabombwe. Furthermore, Edson has been able to grow his working capital and serves more customers, sending and receiving money from his shops. With some of the profits, Edson has been able to rent his own shop for the money transfer business and provide for his growing family.

Edson is requesting another Kiva loan. This will help him to expand his business and increase his working capital in order to ensure that he has enough money to fulfill his customers' transaction needs. He plans to use some of the profits from his growing business to build a house for his family and go back to school.

loans.use: to increase the money he uses to service customers so that he can fulfill his customers' transaction needs.

loans.name: Farangisi

texts.ru:
Фарангис 24 летняя выпускница медицинского колледжа  маленького городка Куляб. В том же городе она живет с семьей. Маме Фарангиса преподаватель. Старшему брату 22 года, он занимается торговлей на местном рынке. Братишке и сестренке Фарангиса по 15 лет,  они учатся в школе. Фарангис окончила колледж, но решила работать не по специальности и выбрала иную деятельность. Фарангис занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она сначала увлеклась шитьем, но теперь для нее это не только любимое занятие и, но источник дохода в семью. 
На данный момент Фарангис уже достаточно опытная швея и она решила получить кредит, чтобы купить профессиональную современную швейную машинку. С помощью кредита она приобретет долгожданную машинку, и улучшить качество работы.
texts.en: Farangisi is a 24-year-old graduate from a medical college located in Kulob.  She lives in Kulob  with her family.  Her mother is a teacher.  The oldest of her brothers, age 22, is a vendor at the local market.  She also has a sister and another brother who are both 15 and still in school.  Although Farangisi graduated from college, she decided to get involved in a different field than her specialty.  She now works as a seamstress, taking orders and sewing women's dresses.  From the start, she has really enjoyed her activity.  Sewing is now not only her favorite activity but it also constitutes a source of income for her family.  Farangisi is now an experienced seamstress and she has decided to request a loan in order to buy a modern and professional sewing machine.  Thanks to his loan, she will be able to purchase a long-awaited machine, which will help her to improve the quality of her work.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
At the age of 34, Naziran is a married woman with six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business selling animals. She has been doing it for many years. She also sells milk to earn an extra amount of income.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help to generate more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида молодая замужняя жена и мать. Ей всего 22 года. Она живет с мужем и родителями мужа. Умида не смотря на свой возраст, она уже 3 года занимается скотоводством, куплей и продажей скотин. Она покупает бычков и после откорма перепродает их. Таким образом, Умида приносит доход в семьи. Ее муж так же занимается данной деятельностью. На сегодняшний день возникли семейные финансовые проблемы,  по которым она  обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить бычков для деятельности. Она верит, что ее поддержат, и она сохранить малый бизнес.
texts.en: Umida is a young married mother.  She is 22 years old and she lives with her husband and her husband's parents.  In spite of her young age, Umida has been involved in animal husbandry for three years already.  Specifically she buys and sells young bulls, which she fattens for resale.  Thanks to her work, she is able to bring an income home.  Her husband is also involved in the same activity.  Umida's family is now facing new financial problems, and this is the reason why she has decided to apply for a loan.  She will use her loan to buy young bulls.  Umida believes that she will receive some support and that she will be able to keep her small business.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is a teacher from Yerevan. She gives lectures to university entrants from her house. Due to her nice attitude and good knowledge, Karine has two groups of students. The requested loan is very important for Karine to be able to purchase a projector to provide training to her students. Karine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The startup loan program provides business startup loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This lecturer seeks your assistance to provide better conditions for her students.

loans.use: to pay for a projector to provide training to her students.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Pathani has expertise in embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family for over nine years. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community, to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

In order to purchase raw material, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She will use this to purchase more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and glittering material. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Pathani has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and glittering material.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 31-year-old married woman. For about 4 years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in much demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele. This allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, with some packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors with some packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 47-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children who is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son (shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, oil, sugar, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, oil, sugar, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old married man with two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft and insecurity.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will increase the living standards for his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been selling milk with her husband for many years. Kalsoom has become famous for providing good-quality milk and she makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to earn an extra amount of income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Kalsoom is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a 25-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), has been selling toys for many years. They make enough money to support the needs of the family members.  Zarina needs to expand her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of toys.  This includes games, cars, and balls in large quantities. This would increase their sales, which will ultimately help to generate more cash. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy packs of toys, including games, cars, and dolls in large quantities.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has five children and has been running a business selling artificial jewelry for many years with the support of her husband. She offers a variety of earrings, bracelets, rings, etc. Over time, she has become famous in her town and has developed a good client list. In order to add variety to her collection, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. With the help of this loan, she will be able to purchase a variety of earrings, bracelets, bangles, etc. She hopes to increase her income through larger sales. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of earrings, bracelets, bangles, etc.

loans.name: Mukhtiaran

texts.en: Mukhtiaran is a 44-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family; however, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. She is positive that, with this loan amount, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers on time. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Luis Napoleon

texts.es: Don Luis es un hombre que desde muy niño le gusta el trabajo del campo y se dedica a la ganadería y Agricultura, su esposa se dedica al cuido de sus tres hijos que todos están en edad escolar, a don Luis se le presento una necesidad de reparar las cercas de sus potreros para que el ganado este en mejores condiciones,  por lo que solicita financiamiento para la compra de Alambre de púas, grapas, postes, y pagar mano de obra.   Su mayor propósito en un futuro es poder comprar una casa más amplia para darle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Luis is a man who has enjoyed working in the fields since he was a child, and he makes a living ranching and farming.  His wife devotes herself to taking care of their three school-age children.  The need has arisen for Luis to make repairs around his pastures so that his livestock can be in better condition.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy barbed wire, staples, and posts and to pay for labor.  His greater purpose is to be able to buy a bigger house in the future so that his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, staples, and posts to make repairs nearby

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Ameena is a hardworking, married woman. She deals in the business of selling cloth in her locality.  She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors, designs for the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Ameena is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flasks, pins, pampers, napkins and wrapper.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 31 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband is a primary teacher and she has been in the farming business for ten years. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top-up loan for farmers who have received Agric Production financing for maize production and that are waiting for their harvest to be bought. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing.

This is significantly scaring their production, as more suffer post-harvest poverty while waiting for the buyer to pay. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: to pay for warehouse construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, alcohol, assorted drinks, and biscuits.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANOU ont en moyenne  35 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des produits alimentaires et des articles divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANOU sont à leur  3ème  prêt solidaire. ADIARRATOU 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50Kg d’oignon, 25Kg de sel, 20Kg de piment, 5 paniers de tomate et 20 litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kanou Group are, on average, 35 years old and have five children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Bla/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family and through selling food products.

This will be the third group loan for these women, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Adiarratou (second from the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 50 kg of onions, 25 kg of salt, 20 kg of chillies, 5 baskets of tomatoes and 20 litres of oil.  She buys her supplies locally and in the surrounding villages, and sells them to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Adiarratou expects to make a monthly average profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to pay for healthcare costs, food and school fees.  The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña guapa está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres luchadoras que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rafaela, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, además de eso ella es la presidenta de este grupo, y siempre se esfuerza por motivar a sus compañeras a seguir luchando. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y es gracias a ese trabajo que ayuda a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Rafaela solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña guapa" is in its seventh cycle of the women's committee program. All group members work and help each other to get ahead. They are hard-working women who want to give their families everything they could not have. 

One of the group members is Rafaela. She is very hard-working and, as president of the group, always tries to motivate the others to keep fighting. She sells clothing items, a job that allows her to support her family and give them what they need to have a decent life. 

Rafaela is requesting this loan to buy clothing items, which will help her to finish her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des produits alimentaires et des produits divers. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. KADIA 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30Kgs de pomme de terre, 3 paniers de papaye, 30Kgs de banane et 20Kgs de patate douce. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognogotala Group are, on average, 39 years old and have four children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Bla/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family ties, and through selling various food and other products.

This will be the first group loan for these women.

Kadia (sitting at the front of the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 30 kg of potatoes, 3 baskets of papayas, 30 kg of bananas and 20 kg of sweet potatoes.  She buys her supplies locally and sells them to both men and women, for cash or on credit.

Kadia expects to make an average monthly profit of 14,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare costs, food and school fees.  The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo de Mujeres llamado San Isidro, son de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias las unas a las otras, trabajan juntas en actividades variadas, luchando por poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Agustina es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos dulces de manera ambulante, vive en casa propia con su hija que es estudiante y también le ayuda con las ventas y la preparación de sus biscochos y confites.
La Sra. Solicita  este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, mantecas, dulce de leche y demás, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus masas dulces, y seguir luchando. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The women's group called San Isidro is original from the city of San Ignacio. They are very close and support each other, working together in different activities and fighting to get ahead. Agustina is the president of the group and works as a street seller selling sweets. She lives in her own house with her daughter, who is studying and also helps with the business's sales and preparation of cakes and candy. 

She is requesting this loan to buy flour, yiest, butter, "dulce de leche" syrup and other items, so that she can keep producing and getting ahead. They are grateful for this opportunity, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy flour, yiest, butter, "dulce de leche" syrup and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en el  ciclo número 15° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder  trabajar.
Miguela es parte de este grupo, es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas variadas de plata que vende sobre pedidos de sus clientes. Miguela ayuda a su familia por medio de este trabajo, y su sueño es poder crecer y algún día tener un negocio fijo y propio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas, para que por medio de esto pueda seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas is in its 15th cycle of the women's committee program. They all work and help each other to get ahead. A study for the elimination of poverty is being developed and will provide information on the situation of each woman to help her better. Miguela is a member of the group and a very hard-working person who is fighting to get ahead with her job. She sells silver jewelry on demand, which allows her to support her family. Her dream is to grow and own a stable business one day. 

She is requesting this loan to buy jewelry so that she can sell it and keep improving.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe NIETA ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des habits et des articles divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. KADIATOU 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pantalons, 20 jupes 30 foulards, 3 pièces de wax et  20 mètres de bazin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Nieta Group are, on average, 47 years old and have four children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Bla/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family ties, and sell food, clothing and various other products.

This will be the third group loan for these women, the previous loans were both fully and correctly repaid.

Kadiatou (standing second from the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 20 pairs of trousers, 20 skirts, 30 scarves, 3 wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and 20 metres of damask fabric.  She buys her supplies locally from wholesalers, and sells her clothing to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Kadiatou expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be used to pay for healthcare and food.  The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es soltera pero tiene un hijo Nancy vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticrético Nancy trabaja como cocinera y necesita un credito para comprar ollas, sartenes, cucharones. En otras palabras para renovar sus utensilios de trabajo. Nancy es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Nancy is a single mother who lives in La Paz. She lives in a house made of brick and cement and pays an "anticrético" (a transaction whereby a property owner requests a loan from the tenant in exchange for housing, which must be paid back at the end of the contract).
