Please help this hard working and enthusiastic entrepreneur to continue her retail business.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic and body care products for reselling to customers.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 28 years old. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing for the maize production and who are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is significantly improving their yield or production.  During the post-harvest process, they are suffering more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during the period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit lives in Yerevan. She has already applied for a loan from Kiva and asked support for her elder daughter, Meri's, education. Anahit is requesting this one to be able to cover her daughter, Haykuhi's, university tuition. Anahit is very responsible and makes monthly payments of the loan, always on time. She will be very thankful to receive lenders' support again and give her daughter an opportunity to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Haykuhi's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning to start up a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Dora Lilian

texts.es:
Doña Dora tiene 41 años de edad la cual es una mujer que se dedica a la producción de café y al comercio el cual lo desarrolla con la venta de productos AVON de forma ambulante con los diferentes vecinos de la comunidad siendo una amiga quien la incentivara y la motivara. Ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo y ambos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. En compañía de su esposo desarrollan el trabajo de campo como ser limpieza, aplicación de abono, recolección del grano entre otras los fines de semana ya que su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad en la empresa privada de esta forma contribuye más en los ingresos del hogar más la producción del café al final del año y los ingresos de su esposa por medio de los productos AVON. El terreno que juntos trabajan es propio el cual esta cerca de su casa de habitacion. 
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con hogares establecidos y sólidos. También sueña con ver poder algún día extender sus cultivos de café comprando más tierra y sembrando una variedad de café atractiva para sus clientes y con un buen precio en el mercado ya que de esa forma ella generara ingresos para su familia y fortalecerá la economía en su hogar pues su objetivo es que sus hijos hereden la tierra que hoy en día ella en compañía de su esposo trabajan. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara nutricafe, abono 18-46-0, foliar entre otros que ayudaran a que su cosecha de café se encuentre más asistida y protegida de plagas, enfermedades y los cambios de clima evitando entre hielo en el grano.
texts.en:
Dora, age 41, is a coffee producer.  She also sells Avon products in an itinerant manner to the neighbors in her community.  A friend encouraged and motivated her to do so.  Dora has two children.  They live with her, and both of them go to the community school.  

She does the field work like clearing the field, applying fertilizer, and collecting the harvest, among others, with her husband.  They do this on the week-ends because her husband works as a security guard for a private company.  This way she contributes more income to the household.  Contributions to the household income come from the coffee production at the end of the year and the sale of Avon products.  The land that they work is their own, and it is close to their house.  

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals with established and solid households.  She also dreams of being able to see her coffee crops expanded.  She would buy more land and plant a variety of coffee that is attractive to her customers with a good price in the market.  This way she would generate income for her family and strengthen the household finances.  Her objective is for her children to inherit the land that she and her husband now work.

Therefore she is now requesting a loan to buy leaf fertilizer and 18-46-0 fertilizer, among others.  These products will help her coffee harvest to be better cared for and protected from pests, diseases, and climate changes such as ice on the beans.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for and protect her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anjani

texts.en:
Anjani is 21 years old, a young entrepreneur who has studied till eighth grade. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Both of them are too young to go to school. 

Anjani is very responsible, persistent and kind by nature. She started her own dairy farm, which consists of two cows. Her husband is a plumber who works under a contractor and earns INR 250-300 per day and also helps Anjani in her dairy business. Her family is very tight-knit and amicable towards each other. Her business brings in approximately 250 INR every day.

In order to expand her business further, Anjani is requesting for a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase another cow. This will allow her to increase her milk sales. Also, Anjani is planning to save for her children’s education and to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 67 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, ha dedicado su vida a cultivar maíz frijol y maicillo. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia., actualmente  vive con  su esposa quien se encarga de los oficios del hogar, y su hijo quien ha terminado sus estudios como bachiller y que hoy en día le apoya en las actividades agrícolas, pues sus hijos mayores ya formaron su propia familia, Manuel es una persona con muchos valores, siendo también líder de la comunidad en que vive.

La actividad que Manuel realiza es la compra y venta de cerdos, esto lo hace con el apoyo de su esposa. Así también se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, esto lo hace desde que tenía 10 años pues  por las mañanas él acompañaba a sus hermanos y a su padre cuando se iban a trabajar.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas, pues es de la agricultura de donde extrae los granos básicos que forman parte de sus alimentos diarios, pero por el momento Manuel no puede comprar los fertilizantes pues no cuenta con los fondos suficientes.

En un futuro, él planea poder establecer una granja de cerdos, para así tener una fuente de ingresos constantes pues de la agricultura logra sacar ganancia a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 67 years old. He is a very hard-working person. He has dedicated his life to growing beans and sorghum. With lots of effort, he has been able to move his family ahead. He currently lives with his wife who takes care of household duties and his son who has finished secondary school. His son now helps Manuel with the farming duties. His older children now have their own families. Manuel is a man of many principles, he is a leader in his community. 

Manuel buys and sells pigs. He does this with the help of his wife. He has also farmed since he was ten years old. He accompanied his brothers and his father when they went to work. 

The loan will be used to purchase farming supplies. Currently, Manuel can not purchase fertilizers since he does not have sufficient funds. 

In the future, he plans to establish a pig farm in order to have a constant source of income since agriculture is able to make long-term profits.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a positive and hardworking woman in her late 40s. She is married and has two sons. Her elder son has completed engineering while her younger son is a plumber. The family lives in Jarmundi village, Dumka, Jharkhand. 

Initially Kalyani and her husband were in an earthen pot-making business, but it didn’t run well and incurred losses. Since there is a good demand for milk products in their locality, they started a dairy business. She earns around 300 INR per day.

She now plans to improve her farm so that she can earn more income. She is requesting a loan to buy one more cow for her farm. She will use the profit to repay the loan and to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Memissala, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Yama debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Niena et Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women averaging 43 years of age, with four children. They all live in polygamous families sin Memissala,  a village in the circle of Dambela, in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).
T
hey collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their previous loans. They grow corn, which is what Yama does, for example. She is the one standing in the middle. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers to work two ha [5 acres] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce in her village, in Niena  and Sikasso, to a mixed clientele.

She plans to earn  about 175,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. These revenues will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 29 years old. She is married and has been blessed with one child. She has been practicing livestock farming in  the Kangundo area for three years now. Her estimated monthly income is KES.6,000.

She would like a second loan of KES.15,000, through which she will buy more feed for her livestock and increase her income.  She will use her anticipated profits to add cattle for rearing. In future, she wishes that her life would financially improve.

loans.use: to boost her farming by buying feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Gs Flor De Cafe Group

texts.es:
Doña Victoria es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, Ella vende abarrotería actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y lo atiende de manera personal, todos los días de la semana se levanta muy temprano a atender a sus clientes, siendo estos principalmente los vecinos de su misma comunidad y personas que trabajan en las diferentes fincas  de café de la zona, Ella cuenta con otro ingreso venta de cuajada, ella comenta que con el crédito anterior que le otorgo lo utilizo para surtir su negocio,  el cual le ha ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su nivel de vida familiar.
Doña Victoria está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para surtir su negocio y obtener más ganancias, con el préstamo podrá comprar productos como manteca, refrescos, azúcar, maseca, arroz blanco y precosido, churros, cubitos, leche, queso, molino, jabones, café, machetes y otros artículos para la venta.
Ella solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas,
María su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de abarrotería en   general, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años.
Mónica su  fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de abarrotería actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años.
Rosa su fuente principal de ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de ropa nueva actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años.
todas ellas no cuentan con el capital suficiente para surtir sus respectivos negocios y desean salir adelante con sus familias.

Danlí, Honduras – Abril  2014
texts.en:
Doña Victoria is an entrepreneur and hard-working woman who sells groceries in her house. She has been in the business for 6 years and works everyday from early morning to serve her customers, mainly neighbors of the community and people who work in the coffee plantations of the area. She also sells junket, which gives her some extra income. 

She used her previous loan to stock the business and was able to increase her income and improve the quality of life of her family. Victoria is now requesting a new loan to buy groceries and increase her revenues. She will use the loan to buy butter, sodas, sugar, corn flour, white rice, "churros", milk, cheese, mills, soap, coffee and machetes, among other items. 

She is requesting the loan jointly with the following women: 
- María, whose main income source is her grocery business. She has been selling groceries for 3 years. 
- Mónica, whose main income source is her grocery business too. She has been selling groceries for 20 years. 
- Rosa, whose main income source is her clothing business. She has been selling new clothes for 2 years. 

Given that these four women do not have enough capital to stock their businesses, they have decided to request the loan as a group. This will allow them to get ahead with their families. 

Danlí, Honduras - April 2014

loans.use: to buy butter, sodas, sugar, corn flour, white rice, "churros", milk, cheese, mills, soap, coffee and machetes, among other items.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 41 años de edad, casado tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
Marleny is 41 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Oyotún district, a rural area where the population works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Marleny's business is raising and selling of animals, like roosters, young fryer chickens, and hens; she has more than 10 years of experience in this business. She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a greater quantity of animals. This investment will enable her to have greater variety and productivity in her animals, which will greatly influence her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals to fatten and offer for sale at a better price.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is a married woman with four children. She is 30 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analou has a general store business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for four years.

Analou requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Analou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is a singer. He works at a local theater as a soloist. Ashot is also a student of art in the local university  He has now applied for this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition.  His salary is hardly enough for covering family's basic costs so the loan would be a great support for Ashot.
He lives in Vanadzor town with his mother and sister. His father is a migrant laborer but currently isn't supporting his family financially, so Ashot is the only breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Rosary

texts.es:
Rosary tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rustico, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hija menor de edad; el domicilio se ubica en la parte rural del Distrito Pucara, la comunidad es una pequeña una zona urbano-rural donde los habitantes se conocen se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Rosary es la venta de comida hace 2 años y también se dedica crianza de animales menores, actividad que realiza hace 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de ingredientes para sus preparos como arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosary is a 30-year old single mother who lives in a rustic family house with her minor daughter. Their house is located in the rural part of the Pucara district, an urban-rural community where people know each other and work in agriculture, trade and stockbreeding. It's located in the province of Jaen, in the region Cajamarca, north mountains of Perú. 

Rosary has been selling food for 2 years and also breeds small animals, an activity that she has been doing for 5 years. She has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternativa for 800 new soles to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as rice, oil and sugar, among others. Her goal is to obtain higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as rice, oil and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 34 años de edad, es un hombre muy luchador que a pesar de solo haber estudiado cuarto grado de educación básica, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, tuvo que abandonar los estudios por ayudar a su padre, su esposa una mujer que le apoya en las actividades agrícolas y sus cinco hijos quienes aún son menores de edad estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. 

Mario se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde los 13 años de edad, junto con su padre y sus  hermanos sembraban maíz, frijol, hortalizas las cuales comercializa en el mercado del municipio y en la misma comunidad.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar los productos agrícolas, quiere comprar fertilizantes lo más pronto posible, pues la apoca lluviosa ha comenzado y es el momento indicado para sembrar.

Su sueño en un futuro es poder establecer una parcela donde pueda cultivar hortalizas de toda variedad para vender y así obtener más ingresos para remodelar la casa y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old. He is tenacious man who, despite having only a fourth-grade education, has managed to provide for his family. He had to give up his studies to help his father. His wife is a woman who supports him in his agricultural activities; his five children, who are still minors, go to the community school.

Mario has been working in farming since he was 13 years old with his father and siblings, growing corn, beans, and vegetables, which they sell in the municipal market and in the community itself.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural products; he wants to buy fertilizers as soon as possible, as the rainy season has begun and that is the right time to plant. His dream for the future is to be able to establish a parcel where he can grow all kinds of vegetables to sell in order to earn more income to remodel his house and give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products, specifically fertilizers.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar, la socia vende regalos y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de bazar. La socia solicita el credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Member still works running her store. She sells gifts and decorations. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to buy decorations and stuffed animals. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy decorations and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando  al negocio de venta de comida,ella tiene un restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ubaldina continues with her business of selling food. She has a restaurant where she makes different meals like baked chicken, soups and beef saltado (a traditional Peruvian dish). The member works from 8 am until 5 pm and has been running this business for a number of years. Things are going well for her. Her dream is to own a restaurant. Ubaldina is requesting a loan to buy products to cook like rice, vegetables and chicken. She is pleased with the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: John Mauricio

texts.es:
John es un hombre amante de su esposa y del trabajo duro para conseguir objetivos.
Su oficio es el de reparar y comercializar celulares y elementos como estuches y repuestos para los mismos en un local cerca al parque principal de una vereda de Planeta Rica, Córdoba, pero eso no es todo, es un hombre bien preparado ya que se dedica alternamente a la reparación de electrodomésticos e instalaciones eléctricas, aunque no ha recibido ningún tipo de capacitación se ha movido exitosamente en este campo.
El solicita un aliento económico para surtir sus exhibidores con más celulares y más elementos de protección para estos.
El crédito le permitirá surtir su inventario y obtener más ingresos a través de sus ventas.
texts.en:
John is a man devoted to his wife and to working hard to achieve his goals.

His trade is repairing and selling mobile phones, accessories like cases, and parts for them. His shop is close to the main park in a rural community of Planeta Rica, Córdoba. But that is not all; he is a well-prepared man, as he also earns his living repairing small appliances and electrical fixtures. Although he has not received any type of training, he knows his way around this field very well.

He is requesting economic relief to stock his display cases with more cellular phones and more protective accessories for them. The loan will allow him to stock up his inventory and earn more income through his sales.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and mobile phone parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Leticia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en el Centro Poblado de Laynas, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y crianza de aves la misma que la realiza hace más de 1 año en el caserío, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz, y alimento para sus aves y de esta manera engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 20 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in a house that she owns in the town of Laynas. The community in this rural area of the La Matanza district works in farming, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the province of Morropon, which is in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast.

Elizabeth's business is the sale of beer and "chicha de jora" [a fermented corn beverage], and raising poultry. She has done this for more than one year in her rural community. She has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of corn and poultry feed so that she can fatten her birds and offer them for sale at a better price.

loans.use: to buy corn and feed for her poultry

loans.name: Mavis Dzifa

texts.en:
Mavis is a final year student at the Health Concern Ghana and hopes to be a professional caregiver in the years to come.

"The completion of my studies would provide me with the necessary skills to reduce maternal mortality wherever I find myself in the nursing fraternity, so without this education, my dreams cannot be realized.

My heart bleeds anytime a woman goes into labor and dies through delivery and it is my heart most desire to reach out to such people and others any way that my skills can afford me, and that alone is motivation enough.

I see myself becoming a professional mid-wife in 5 or 10 years.

Without this facility, my dreams will come to end because I have no other alternative and the result would be a disadvantage to my community.

I would want investors around the world to know that there are a lot of investment opportunities where I come from, Kpando in the Volta Region of Ghana, so they should take advantage of that".

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy text books

loans.name: Kelim Yao

texts.en:
Kelim is a student and hopes to be resourceful for himself and his family in the near future. 

"I see myself working for a big corporation in Africa and my education will allow me to take good care of my family in the near future. My chosen profession interests me because of the love I have for gizmos. I will acquire enough knowledge to enable me to offer help to people in my community and to my family. I am inspired by my father and mother to go higher in my education. They inspire me because I have seen them work hard over the years to put food on the table and clothes on our bodies every time, even though it wasn’t there all the time.

Without this loan, my education would have been affected because my dad has passed on and my mother shoulders all the family responsibilities, including her business staff and extended family.

I want my community, city, and country to be one of the best, where every up and coming young man can fend for himself without the hassle of relying on people or family for support".

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees and text books

loans.name: Dilma Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Dilma tiene 30 años de edad quien se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol siendo su familia quien le apoye en las actividades de campo a desarrollar. Ella es casada y en su juventud tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta la secundaria terminando sus primeros 3 años de ciclo común. Es madre de 4 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación pues al salir de sus actividades se involucran en el campo junto a sus padres. Desde hace 10 años ha desarrollado estas actividades siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran dicha actividad y en compañía de su esposo siguen ejerciendo. El terreno que en familia trabajan es propio el cual le pertenece a su esposo ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual fácilmente se dirigen caminando para su respectiva limpieza y cuidado. Doña Dilma ve como único desafío la inestabilidad de precios sobre los insumos que son utilizados para mantener sanos sus cultivos en el mercado por lo que hoy en día solicita financiamiento para la compra de los mismos los cuales ayudaran a mantener sus cultivos de maíz y frijol protegidos de plagas. Como productora de granos básicos su meta y propósito es el incremento de su producción, ofrecer más a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos en su familia y poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Dilma is 30 years old and has dedicated herself to cultivating corn and beans. Her family helps in her farming activities. She is married. In her youth, she had the opportunity of studying up to secondary school, having completed her 1st 3 years of the common cycle. Dilma is the mother of 4 children who study in the community school in different grades. Upon completing school activities, they too work in the fields alongside their parents.

Dilma has been involved in these activities for some 10 years, since it was her parents who taught her to farm, and she still works the fields with her husband. The land the family cultivates is their own, having originally belonged to her husband. It's located quite close to their residence, making it easy to reach on foot and to clear and care for it. 

Dilma sees as her only challenge the instability of prices for the inputs they must utilize in order to keep their crops healthy and marketable. that is why she is requesting financing for the purchase of those same inputs, to help maintain her corn and bean crops and protect them from plagues.

As a producer of basic grains, Dilma's goal and main proposition is to increase production, offering more to her customers and generating greater income to cover family expenses and provide a better style of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to boost her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition and hostel fees

loans.name: Gs Denis Group

texts.es:
El señor Denis se dedica al comercio y es una persona emprendedora de su comunidad su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio, la venta y reparación de maquinas despulpadoras de café, esto lo realiza desde hace 15 años, el cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa de habitación, sus principales clientes son personas de las zonas montañosas de Jamastran, estas maquinas sirven para sacar la pulpa del café y como el uso es continuo en temporada el señor Denis se encarga de repararlas.
Don Denis solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de materiales como ser, lamina liza, electrodos para soldar, y otros materiales para su taller, el sueña con tener un taller más grande y con todas las herramientas necesarias, el solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, Juan se dedica al comercio y tiene una pequeña venta de abarrotería en su casa de habitación desde hace 2 años.
Gloria se dedica a la venta de huevos de casa, ella tiene gallinas ponedoras desde hace 2 años.
todos ellos no cuentan con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de su clientes y desean salir adelante por medio de financiamiento con Prisma y Kiva.

Danlí, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Denis is an enterprising person working in his community. His main source of income is his business, where he sells and repairs coffee pulpers. He has been doing this for fifteen years. He has a small shop set up in his home, and his customers are mainly people from the mountainous areas of Jamastran. These machines take the pulp out of coffee beans, and since they get constant use during the season, Denis is in charge of repairing them.

Denis is requesting this loan in order to buy materials like sheet metal, soldering electrodes, and other items for his shop. His dream is to have a larger shop and all the necessary tools. 

He is requesting the loan as a group, alongside the following people: Juan works in retail and has run a small grocery store from his home for two years. Gloria has three hens and has been working selling eggs for two years. None of them have enough capital to meet their customers' demand, and they want to get ahead with support from Prisma and Kiva.

Danlí, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, soldering electrodes, and other materials for his shop.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio Adrian se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar y tambien al negocio de venta de artesania, el socio vende regalos y adornos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de bazar. El socio solicita el  credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Adrian continues with his sales business and with his business of selling handicrafts. He sells gifts, and ornaments, and he works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. He has various years in this business and it is going very well for him. His dream is to grow his sales business. He is requesting a loan to buy ornaments and stuffed animals. 

He is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the instalments.

loans.use: to buy ornaments and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his education expenses.

loans.name: Alex Roberto

texts.es:
El joven Alex es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 6 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Alex necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para seguir realizando su trabajo el desea comprar Azucar, Arroz, Frijoles, manteca, harina, churros, refrescos, jabones, pan, leche y otros productos para su negocio; el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario, y con esta ayuda poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Alex espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del  2014
texts.en:
Alex is a very hardworking and responsible young man. He lives in a community in southern Honduras with his family. His business is a grocery store, which he has been running for six years. It is located in his home.

Alex needs this loan to buy more products to continue doing his job. He wants to buy sugar, rice, beans, lard, flour, churros, soft drinks, soap, bread, milk, and other products for his business, which provides him with most of his income. He expects his sales to increase substantially thanks to this loan. It will be of great help to him, because he doesn't have the products he needs in order to cover his customers' daily orders, and this loan will enable him to improve his family's quality of life by increasing his household income.

Alex hopes to make his business grow in the near future so that he can continue to support his family and so that his children can get the education they need in order to have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – April, 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, lard, flour, churros, soft drinks, soap, bread, milk, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Daisy is 29 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Daisy has a selling ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Daisy has been in this business for 3 years. Daisy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Arlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Arlyn has been in this business for 1 year now.

Arlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has purified drinking water and soft drink business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Sofia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Sofía  de 38 años  de edad, es casada y vive en su casa de habitación con su esposo donde se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos desde hace mas de 5 años, sus ventas son de forma ambulantes por las diferentes aldeas de la zona donde cuenta con mucha clientela la cual le esperan siempre para consumir sus productos como jaiba, pescado blanco y pescado rojo, y curiles, es conocida por ser una persona muy luchadora ya que con las ganancia pudo construir su vivienda, es conocida por ser una persona muy amble y con el deseo de seguir mejorando sus ingresos. Ella radica en la aldea Campamento Nacaome Valle al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Sofia esta solicitando 11,000 lempira para compra de jaiba, pescado blanco y pescado rojo, y curiles,  Con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea seguir invirtiendo en su  negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.. 
Su sueño es invertir más en su negocio y seguir obteniendo mejores ganancias.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – ABRIL 2014.
texts.en:
Sofía is 38 years old, married and lives in her home with her husband.  For over five years, she has worked buying and selling seafood.  She is a traveling salesperson and makes her sales throughout the different towns in her region.  She has many customers who always wait for her to consume her products such as crabs, white and red fish, and curiles (a type of mollusk).  She is known for being a fighter because with her earnings, she was able to build her home.  She is also know for being a very kind woman with a dream of continuing to improve her income.  She lives in the town of Campamento Nacaome Valle in southern Honduras.  

Sofia is seeking 11,000 Lempira to purchase jaiba, white and red fish, and curiles (a type of mollusk).  With the support of this loan, she hopes to continue investing in her business and improving her income.  Her dream is to invest more into her business and continue to generate greater earnings.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- April, 2014.

loans.use: purchase crab, white and red fish, and curiles (type of mollusk).

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en:
Felicity is single mother blessed with three children aged between 18 and 4. She is the sole breadwinner for her family. She is a dairy farmer at a business she has been operating for four years.
                 
She has taken her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase dairy meal for her cows and other farm inputs so that she may get much more milk to supply to her clients and plow back into the business and also pay school fees for her children.
    
Her dreams are to see her business prosper and be able to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to purchase some dairy meal to feed her cows.

loans.name: Gustavo Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás tiene 59 años de edad, separado hace más de 03 años, vive en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nicolas es brindar servicio de animación de diferentes eventos, cuenta con un equipo de sonido propio, el cual lo alquila al público en general, tiene experiencia en el rubro , ha solicitado un préstamo da Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de implementos para su equipo de sonido y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 59 years old and has been separated more than three years. He lives in the district of  Pucará, a community with a warm climate whose population works in agriculture and business. It's located in the province of  Jaén that belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

The activity that Nicolás does is to provide entertainment services for different events. He depends on his own sound equipment which he rents to the public, and he has experience in the field. He has requested the loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase new tools for his sound equipment and in this way to offer better service.

loans.use: to buy tools for his sound equipment

loans.name: Emelin Morena

texts.es:
Las personas que visitan la pulpería de Emelin Morena salen satisfechos porque encuentran  todo lo que necesitan,  desde granos básicos, condimentos, calzado  y  papel higiénico, hasta cremas corporales y tintes para el cabello. La microfinanciera KIVA Mi Crédito desempeña un rol fundamental en su vida.  Gran parte del éxito de su negocio se debe a  ellos, porque la han apoyado con el capital necesario.
Emelin es una mujer visionaria y desea continuar invirtiendo en su pulpería. Planea la compra de un exhibidor, de esa forma mostrará más productos  y un freezer,  para vender bebidas, hielo y todo tipo de carnes.  Ella volvió a recurrir al apoyo de  KIVA Mi Crédito con el fin de conseguir capital para este proyecto que le generará  buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The people who visit Emelin Morena's grocery store leave satisfied because they find everything that they need from basic grains, condiments, footwear and toilet paper, even body creams and hair dyes.  The micro financing organization Kiva Mi Crédito plays a fundamental role in her life.  A large part of her business's success is due to them because they have supported her with the necessary capital.  

Emelin is a visionary women and wishes to continue investing in her grocery store.  She plans to purchase a display case to show off more of her merchandise, and a freezer to sell beverages, ice and all types of meats.  She returned to enlist Kiva Mi Crédito's support with the goal of obtaining capital for this project that will generate great earnings.

loans.use: purchase a display case to display more products and a freezer.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 40 years old. He is married and together with his wife has been blessed with three children. He has been supplying bread in Eastlands area for 14 years now. He would like to expand his current business and currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He would like a loan of KES 100,000 through which he will be able to buy another motorcycle for transporting bread to more clients. He is now borrowing his twelfth loan with VisionFund Kenya and has repaid all his previous loans.  

He will use his anticipated profits to build on his upcountry land. In the future, he hopes to set up a large shop upcountry once the building of the shop is done.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for supplying bread.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is 38 years old and married. Her spouse adds additional income to the family. She serves 8 people in the family. She has five children ranging between fifteen and five years. She has been in business for 15 years. Her monthly income is 150,000 KES. She has borrowed to buy more maize. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees and to buy basic needs. She repaid the previous loan successfully. This is her sixth loan and her hopes and dreams are to buy a plot for business and educate her children to the highest level of education.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Juan Cirilo

texts.es:
Juan Cirilo tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Las Delicias, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para invertir en construcción de su vivienda con la compra de calamina, adobe y madera que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Cirilo is 56 years old. He is in a common-law marriage with no children in his care. He lives in a house that he owns in the small community of Las Delicias, a rural area of the Oyotún district. The community works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Juan Cirilo earns his living raising and selling farm animals. His business is located at his home. He has requested a loan of 3,500 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the construction of his home by purchasing corrugated metal, adobe, and wood; this will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy adobe construction materials, corrugated metal sheeting, and wood for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, soil amendments, and fertilizers to prepare the soil for growing vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Kato Allama 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KATO ALLAMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bougoulaba, un des villages de la commune de Wateni dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec  Djenebou assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 215.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kato Allama 2 group are married women with an average age of 43 years and an average of 4 children each, who all live in polygamous families in Bougoulaba, one of the villages of the Wateni community in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

The woman are partnering with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the organization, and their previous loans have all been fully repaid.

Djenebou, sitting on the far right in the photo, grows and cultivates corn. With her loan, she plans to purchase farming supplies and seeds to maintain two hectares of land. She sells her crops in her village and in Sikasso after harvesting them, to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Djenebou plans to earn an average income of 215,000 francs CFA per field. This will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and seeds

loans.name: Dora Angelica

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de brosteria,la socia vende pollos a la brasa con papas fritas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de brosteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
She continues dedicating herself to her rotisserie chicken business.  She sells rotisserie chickens with french fries.  She works from 8am to 7pm.  She has been in this business for many years, and it has gone very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her business.

She is seeking a loan to purchase chickens and potatoes.  She is very happy for the loan and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase chickens and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio Edmundo se sigue dedicando al negocio de brosteria,el socio vende pollos a la brasa con papas fritas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de brosteria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas.

 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Edmundo continues to dedicate himself to his rotisserie chicken business.  He sells rotisserie chickens with french fries.  He works from 8am to 7pm.  He has been in this business for many years and it has gone very well for him.  His dream is to expand his business.  He is seeking a loan to purchase chickens and potatoes.  He is grateful for the loan and he is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase chickens and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ventas de adornos de navidad y tambien ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member still earns her living selling Christmas decorations; now she also is running a clothing-sales business. She sells pants, blouses, and t-shirts. Her dream is to have a shop. She is requesting the loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, and blouses. 

She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, and blouses

loans.name: Genoveva Betty

texts.es:
La socia Genoveva Betty continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo llantas, parabrisas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member, Genoveva Betty, continues to earn her living selling auto parts.  She's been in the business for years and it's going well thanks to her daily management.  She's still selling tires, windshields and other items.  She wants to be able to keep working so she can continue to support her family.

Genoveva Betty is seeking a loan to buy the windshields and other items.  She feels grateful for the loans and promises to make all required payments.

loans.use: to buy windshields and other items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es una mujer dedicada a embellecer las mujeres de su sector a través de servicios de manicure, pedicura, corte y cepillado de cabello.
Es una mujer alegre, con gran sentido humano y de servicio. Presta sus servicios a domicilio y trabaja todos los días con el objetivo de conseguir recursos para continuar con sus estudios de salud ocupacional.
Ella aspira a un crédito para comprar algunas herramientas e insumos para su trabajo con pinzas, algodón y limas, además requiere de un maletín especializado para el trasporte de estos elementos.
De esta forma podrá prestar un serbio de una manera más cómoda y con mejor calidad, acreditando así su actividad y expandiendo su servicio a más clientes.
texts.en:
Valentina is a woman who is dedicated to beautifying the women of her region through her manicure, pedicure, haircut and hair styling services.  She is a happy woman with great sense of humanity and service.  She takes her services to people's homes and works everyday with the goal of obtaining resources to continue with her education in occupational health.

She is hoping for a loan to purchase certain tools and supplies for her work such as tweezers, cotton and nail files.  She is also in need of a specialized carrying case to transport these tools.  This way, she will be able to provide her services in a more comfortable manner and with better quality, giving her business more credit and expanding her service to more clients.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as cotton, nail files and tweezers, as well as a specialized carry case to transport them.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Memissala, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Achitan debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  d’intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the BENKADI 2 group are married women, who are on average 43 years old and have 4 children, and all of whom live in polygamous families in Memissala, one of the villages in the Dambela commune in the third administrative region of Mali, SIKASSO. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to assist in their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution; the previous loans have been properly repaid. Achitan, the second one standing to the right of the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to maintain two hectares. The corn is sold in the village and at the SIKASSO markets after harvesting to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees earning a monthly average of 175,000 FCFA per season. The profit will be used to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el socio sigue dedicándose a trabajar en el sector educación el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera pueda continuar apoyando a su familia, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de víveres y algunos arreglos para su casa.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermo belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Guillermo continues with his work in the education sector. He hopes to keep working so he can continue to support his family. He has been doing this job for a long time, which brings both personal and financial satisfaction.

Guillermo is requesting a loan to buy groceries and make some improvements to his house. He is grateful for this loan and he promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy groceries and make some improvements to his house.

loans.name: Bahissou

texts.fr:
Monsieur BAHISSOU est né en 1968 à IFOLA cercle de SIKASSO, il est marié et  père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants à MAMASSONI  un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur BAHISSOU n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer aux études,  s’est initié dans l’activité d’achat et de vente de céréales. Il rejoint l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son  premier prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants dans la ville de SIKASSO. Ainsi ce  premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter  15 sacs de 100 kg de mil, 15 sacs de 100 kg de maïs pour la revendre au détail dans son magasin  à MAMASSONI à une clientèle composée d ‘homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec ce premier prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 58 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses et payer les prêt et son intérêts.
texts.en: Mr. BAHISSOU was born in 1968 in the IFOLA circle in SIKASSO. He is a married father of two. He lives with his wife and their children in MAMASSONI, a popular neighborhood in the city of SIKASSO, the third administrative region of the republic of Mali. Mr. BAHISSOU, having not had the opportunity to further his studies, started buying and selling grains. He joined microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan, which will help him augment his business funds in order to respond to the needs of his customers. He stocks up in the neighboring villages in the city of SIKASSO. Thus, this first loan will allow him to buy fifteen 100-kg sacks of millet and fifteen 100-kg sacks of corn to sell at retail in his store in MAMASSONI to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. With this first loan, he foresees earning a monthly average of 58,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover his expenses and repay the loan with interest.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.es:
Praxedes tiene 59 años de edad, casado sin hijos, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, con más de 10 años de experiencia su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Praxedes is 59 years of age, married without children. He lives in the district of Oyotún, in a rural area where the population works in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He makes a living selling groceries, such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, and soda. He has more than ten years of experience, and his business is located in his home. He has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1200 soles for the purchase of a variety of groceries to supply his business, and in this way generate higher earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to supply his business.

loans.name: Beatriz Yolanda

texts.es:
Beatriz vive en la ciudad de Pisco, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día con mucho esfuerzo trabaja como Obrera de campo, Beatriz trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, sobre todo porque es madre de 2 hijos y este humilde empleo es su única fuente de ingresos.

Beatriz esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir una cerca para dar seguridad a su vivienda, con ello podrá trabajar más tranquila, ya que su vivienda estará más segura y seguira trabajando con entusiasmo para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in the city of Pisco. She is a woman with a strong desire to get ahead. That's why she works very hard every day as a field worker. Beatriz works about nine hours a day because she can cover her household costs with what she earns. She is a single mother of two children, and this humble job is her only source of income.

Beatriz is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have provided, she can buy construction materials so that she can build a fence to secure her residence. Then she will be able to work with less stress, since her house will be safer. She will continue working enthusiastically to realize her greatest dream: to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is single and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 27 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Primien

texts.en: Primien is 34 years old, married and has three children, one in school. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan helps farmers who have had received the Agric Production financing for their maize production and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. UOB’s farmers clients benefit from production financing which iincreasing significantly their yield or production. But during the post-harvest processes they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as bridge for meeting their primary day-to-day needs during the period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children. This is a new loan product for Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB). The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing for maize production and who are waiting for their harvest to be bought. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly improving their yield or production. During the post-harvest processes, they are suffering more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for meeting their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: to pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and juice to sell.

Helen has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and juice to sell.

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.en:
Bibiane is 34 years old. She is married with three children. 

This is a new loan product for Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB). The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing for maize production and are waiting for their harvest to be bought. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly improving their yield or production. During the post-harvest processes, they are suffering more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for meeting their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store for maize produce.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en: Theoneste is 27 years old, married, and has two children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan helps farmers who have had received the Agric Production financing for the maize production and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is increasing significantly their yield or production. During the post-harvest processes they usually have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for meeting their primary day-to-day needs during that period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 34 years old, married and lives in the town of Ndola, Zambia. She has two children, ages 4 and 8 years old. Her profession is operating her own Zoona mobile money transfer business.
Jenny is a hard-working and happy woman who has been able to slowly raise her working capital through her small business. She is convinced that her business will be successful because it is what her customers need. It is also located at a busy market which makes it convenient for her customers to use.
The business is Jenny’s only source of income and it helps pay her bills and provide for her growing family. Jenny plans to expand her business by opening additional outlets and making sure that she meets her customer demands.
Jenny is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a trading booth which she will use to operate her business. These branded booths draw in customers which allows her to increase her income through the commissions she earns on each transaction.

loans.use: To purchase a small branded trading booth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to prepare the land and continue farming carrots, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will buy more cartons of fish to increase her market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Muhamed's Group $4,500 loan will be used to buy goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malick âgé de la quarantaine, travaille  dans la santé depuis plus de cinq ans. Il est marié et père de famille et loge à quelques kilomètres de la caisse. Malick n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et c’est un cas social qui l’amène. Il sollicite un montant de 300 000F CFA afin de pouvoir faire face aux frais d’hospitalisations de son frère malade. Le remboursement se fera via son salaire. Malick se charge de la dépense quotidienne et aussi de la scolarité de ses enfants. Cela ne l’empêche pas de donner un coup de main à ses parents, frères et sœurs.
Son souci majeur est de rester à la disposition de ses proches en cas de besoin et il prie de toujours pouvoir les aider et les épauler.
texts.en: Mr. Malick, who is in his forties, has been working on healthcare for more than five years. He is a married father and lives a few kilometers from work. Malick has never before gotten a loan from IMCEC, and it’s a personal reason that brings him there. He is seeking a loan for 300,000 FCFA in order to cover hospitalization expenses for his ill brother. He will repay the loan with his salary. Malick takes care of the daily expenses and also pays for his children’s schooling. This doesn’t prevent him from helping his parents and siblings. His major concern is to stay in the disposition of those close to him in case of need, and he always hopes to help and support them.

loans.use: to cover hospital expenses for his sick brother

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Memissala, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Salimata D en position assise au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  d’intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the BENKADI 3 group are married women, who are on average 43 years old and have 4 children, and all of whom live in polygamous families in Memissala, one of the villages in the Dambela commune in the third administrative region of Mali, SIKASSO. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to assist in their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution; the previous loans have been properly repaid. Salimata D, sitting in the center in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to maintain 1.5 hectares. The corn is sold in the village and at the SIKASSO markets after harvesting to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees earning a monthly average of 200,000 FCFA per season. The profit will be used to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Memissala, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Djeneba N debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  d’intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the BENKADI 4 group are married women, who are on average 43 years old and have 4 children, and all of whom live in polygamous families in Memissala, one of the villages in the Dambela commune in the third administrative region of Mali, SIKASSO. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to assist in their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution; the previous loans have been properly repaid. Djeneba N, the second one standing on the left in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to maintain two hectares. The corn is sold in the village and at the SIKASSO markets after harvesting to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees earning a monthly average of 100,000 FCFA per season. The profit will be used to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María  de 40 años  de edad, es madre soltera vive en su casa de habitación con su hija de 18 años de edad, se dedica desde hace  10 años a la compra de mariscos por mayor sus venta son con las personas de los diferentes comedores de la zona y con personas particulares , también viaja a la capital del país donde cuenta con clientes en los mercados de esa localidad, es una mujer muy luchadora, y se siente satisfecha con el apoyo que se le ha brindado, radica en aldea Campamento Nacaome Valle al sur de Honduras. 
Doña María esta solicitando 11,000 lempiras para compra de mariscos y pescado, con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea seguir invirtiendo en su  negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. 
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para poder salir a mas lugares a vender su pescado y crecer en su negocio para tener mejor calidad de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – ABRIL 2014.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her house with her daughter who is 18 years of age. For the past 10 years, she has worked buying seafood at wholesale and selling it to people from the area's dining places as well as to individuals. She also travels to the country's capital where she has customers in the city's markets. 

She's a very determined woman, and feels satisfied with the support that has been given to her. She lives in  Campamento Nacaome Valle in the south of Honduras.

María is asking for 11,000 Lempiras to buy seafood and fish. With the help of this loan she wants to continue to invest in her business and increase her income. Her dream is to buy a vehicle in order to be able to go to more places to sell her fish and grow her business to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seafood and fish for her business

loans.name: Hector Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio Héctor continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, el socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Héctor continues running his business selling auto parts. He is a responsible and diligent person. He has been in this business for years, which brings both personal and financial satisfaction. He hopes to keep working in this manner so he can continue to support his family.

Héctor is requesting a loan to buy tires, among other things. He is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: to buy tires, among other things.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard, 46, is a father of three and has been a maize farmer for the past 20 years. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan helps farmers who have had received the Agric Production financing for the maize production and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. UOB’s farmers clients are benefiting from the production financing which is increasing significantly their yield or production. But during the post-harvest processes, they have to wait the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for meeting their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store for maize produce.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old, married, and has three children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan helps farmers who have had received the Agric Production financing for their maize production and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. UOB’s farmers clients are benefiting from the production financing which is increasing significantly their yield or production. But during the post-harvest processes, they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for meeting their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: José Inés

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a la situación económica que vivían sus padres y por lo lejos que le quedaba la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, sus hijos algunos viven en sus propios hogares, otros traban y los demás estudian, con José solo viven su esposa y tres de sus hijos.

José se dedica desde hace 25 años a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz frijol, maicillo, aprendió esta actividad nada más fijándose como trabajaban sus padres, desde que era pequeño iba con sus padres a las parcelas donde trabajaba y como no hubo otra actividad productiva más que la agricultura él decidió seguir sembrando ya cuando había aprendido. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a 30 minutos de su casa y se transporta a pie, su tercer hijo es quien le ayuda en esta actividad, también su esposa llevándole los alimentos al lugar donde trabajan, y generalmente trabajan de 6:00 a 1:00 PM.

El préstamo que ha solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como lo son: 2 quintales de fórmula, 4 quintales de sulfato, y con el resto pagará la mano de obra que ayuda en las actividades.
