Con el crédito podrá comprar más barato y también podrá ampliar sus cultivos pues otras veces se ha visto limitado por el factor económico que no le alcanza para cubrir los requerimientos.

El sueño de José es seguir trabajando con créditos con la institución, también pretende mejorar el techo de su vivienda porque ya está un tanto malo y evitar cualquier peligro para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José is 57-years-old.  He never had the opportunity to go to school because of his parents' economic situation and how far away the school was.  He's married and his wife is a homemaker.  Some of their children have their own houses, some work, and the rest are in school.  José lives with only his wife and three of their children.

For 25 years José has earned his living growing basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum.  He learned by just paying attention to how his parents worked.  Since he was little he went with them to work in the fields.  Because he didn't have any other more productive activity than agriculture he decided to keep doing as he had learned.  He works 30 minutes from his house and gets there on foot.  His third child helps him.  His wife does, too, by bringing food to them.  They generally work from 6AM to 1PM.

José needs loan he is seeking from CrediCampo to buy farming supplies, like 2 quintals of fertilizer and 4 quintals of sulfate. He'll use the rest to pay for manual labor to help with his work.  The loan will allow him to buy at lower prices and expand his crop.  At times he has been limited by economic factors and wasn't able to afford what he needed.  

José's dream is to continue to work using loans from CrediCampo.  He also plans to improve his house's roof, which is in really bad condition, in order to avoid any risk to himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies including 2 quintals of fertilizer, 4 quintals of sulfate, and use the rest to pay for labor to help in with his work.

loans.name: Ganizani

texts.en:
Ganizani, 29, is excited about the opportunity to access a Kiva loan. He runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business in his hometown of Kabwe. His business provides financial services to people in the community.

Ganizani completed high school in the year 2004 and then pursued a degree in business administration at a local university in Kabwe. Seeing a need in his community, Ganizani decided to begin operating his mobile money business recently.

Ganizani is excited to be running his own business because he sees this as a way for him to be empowered. He is hopeful that once he gets the loan, he will serve more customers and make additional profit. He says the profits from his anticipated growth will help him send money back home to his parents.

He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him purchase a trading booth. This booth will help his business through improved branding/advertising and the shop will be put in a good high traffic location that will make it easy for new customers to use.

loans.use: To purchase a branded trading booth

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney, 31, continues to grow his Zoona mobile money business because of the opportunity he has to access working capital through Kiva. He has been running the business for four years. He is married and has two young girls, ages 4 months and 4 years old. 
This is Sydney’s second Kiva loan. He used his first loan to serve customers by increasing his working capital at his shop. The increase allowed Sydney to better serve his customers. He says it also helped him increase his profits. 
Today, Sydney continues in his quest to provide good service to his customers. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him finance opening another location. Sydney's Kiva loan will serve as start-up capital for his new small business location. He will be able to purchase a branded trading booth, which he will use to serve customers. 
Sydney would like to take this opportunity to thank his lenders for their support. Sydney does not have the opportunity to access a bank loan because he does not have any collateral. The funding from Kiva is the sole source he has to access capital so he can continue to grow his business and support his family

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth which he will use to serve customers

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou, une dame de 37 ans, s’active dans l’agriculture depuis maintenant cinq ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. A l’approche de chaque hivernage, elle achète des semences pour préparer la saison. Elle vient pour la seconde fois à l’IMCEC afin de bénéficier d’un montant qui lui permettra d’acheter les semences et l’engrais pour exploiter son champ comme chaque année.
Fatou emploie des gens qui s’y connaissent dans le domaine et qu’elle rémunèrera à la fin. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle se prend en charge, et appuie la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes. 
Fatou veut agrandir son espace cultural pour s’adonner à la culture maraichère dont elle s’occupera elle-même.
texts.en: Fatou, a 37-year-old lady, has been in agriculture for five years. She is a married mother of three. Before every rainy season, she buys seeds to prepare for the season. She is coming for the second time to IMCEC in order to benefit from a loan which will allow her to buy seeds and fertilizer to farm her field, as she does every year. Fatou employs people who know the domain and who she will pay at the end. With the profits from her business, she will support her family with the daily expenses. Fatou wants to grow her farm space in order to devote herself to truck farming, which she will take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate her field.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 39 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top-up loan for farmers who have received Agricultural Production financing. These farmers are waiting for their maize harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly improving their yield or production. During the post-harvest processes, they are suffering financially as they wait for the buyers to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is 33 years old. He is married and has seven children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top-up loan for farmers who have received Agricultural Production financing. These farmers are waiting for their maize harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly improving their yield or production. During the post-harvest processes, they are suffering financially as they wait for the buyers to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 6 meses, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertir en compra de cerdos y gallinas que le permitirán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old and single. He lives in his own house in the district of Oyotún, a community whose members work in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

He has been making a living raising and selling farmyard animals for 6 months. His business is located at his home. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles to buy pigs and chickens, which will enable him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en: Frederick is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top-up loan for farmers who have received Agricultural Production financing. These farmers are waiting for their maize harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly improving their yield or production. During the post-harvest processes, they are suffering financially as they wait for the buyers to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse/store for maize production.

loans.name: Tzutujil Group

texts.en:
The “Tzutuhil” are one of the 21 Mayan indigenous groups that live around Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. It is also the name of the language that is spoken by these proud people. Seven women have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank with this name. They are from the peaceful village of San Juan La Laguna, one of the many small towns that dot Lake Atitlan. Because tourism is increasing in this picturesque area, the women of the Trust Bank create and sell traditional weavings, many of which are dyed using seeds, leaves, charcoal, the bark of trees and the juice of fruits like pomegranates. 

These strong-willed women are motivated to create more prosperous lives for themselves and their families. Maria is a 31-year-old single mother, and a prime example of someone who eagerly seeks the tools to elevate herself and her son. Because she grew up in extreme poverty, Maria had little access to formal education. She is seeking her first loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase supplies for dyeing, needles, and thread for her textile business. Maria creates colorful purses, curtains and bedspreads.

Friendship Bridge not only provides loans to over 20,000 clients, but also incorporates education in the monthly meetings of each Trust Bank. A Loan Officer shares relevant and beneficial information on timely subjects like children’s education and nutrition, effective business management including budgeting, accounting and customer service. Other topics covered include self-esteem and women’s rights as well as medicinal plants and health. It is the combination of the loans and education that makes the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge such a wonderful vehicle for these impoverished women to leave poverty behind.
KIVA investors are valuable collaborators with Friendship Bridge and are greatly appreciated. Maria and the six ladies in the “Tzutuhil” Trust Bank are poised to face a brighter, happier and more prosperous tomorrow because of their small loans and education. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and generosity!

loans.use: To purchase supplies for dyeing, needles, and thread for her textile business.

loans.name: Matilde Florentina

texts.es:
Matilde Florentina tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que se caso y de esta manera poder contribuir con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz amarillo duro y de esta manera engordar sus animales y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Matilde Florentina is 53 years old and lives in the district of Oyotún, where the people work in agriculture, run businesses or raise livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast.

Matilde has raised and sold animals ever since she got married and in this way contributes to family finances. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,500 soles to buy yellow corn to feed to the animals so she can sell them for a good price.

loans.use: Compra de maíz amarillo duro y de esta manera engordar sus animales

loans.name: Yovana Nancy

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo llantas, parabrisas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yovana Nancy continues running her business selling auto parts. She has been in business for years and it going well thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday. She continues to sell tires and windshields, among other things. She hopes to keep working in this manner to continue supporting her family.

Yovana Nancy is requesting this loan to buy windshields, among other things. She is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: to buy windshields, among other things.

loans.name: Jose Jesus

texts.es:
José Jesús tiene 54 años de edad, vive al lado de su conyugue tiene dos hijos en su poder de 18 y 11 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio Secundario santo tomas, residen en el Caserío San Juan Pampa , una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza José Jesús es la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee reses de su propiedad, su ganado vacuno lo cría en sus invernas tiene experiencia en el rubro desde que se caso, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de (02 de vacas lecheras) y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Jesús is 54 years old. He and his wife have two children aged 18 and 11. The younger one is a student at the Santo Tomás Secondary School. The family lives in the village of San Juan Pampa, in a rural part of the district of Santo Tomás, located in the province of Cutervo which belongs to the region of Cajamarca on Peru's northern coast.

José Jesús earns his living raising and selling cattle, providing winter pasture for them on his land. He has done this kind of work since he got married. He has asked for a loan of 4,000 soles to buy two milk cows so he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to increase her market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to increase her business.

loans.name: Sonia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar como agente policial, y solamente tienen dos  hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y son las únicas que dependen de él.

Sonia se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y recibe ingresos de su esposo y remesas que le envía un hermano que reside en los Estados Unidos.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar 7 rollos de alambre de púas y 6 libras de grampas para cercar un terreno que le heredó su padre, también pagará $150 en concepto de mano de obra y pagará el resto del crédito que tiene pendiente. Con el crédito será satisfecha la necesidad de tener bien delimitado su terreno por un cerco y así evitar problemas a futuro con sus vecinos.

El sueño de Sonia es hacer una nueva casa junto con su esposo ya que donde viven es una casa que fue  mal construida y que no garantiza seguridad para ella ni su familia. Por otra parte sueña ver que sus hijas estudien y puedan lograr una carrera universitaria y que no pasen por las dificultades económicas que ella paso cuando era joven. Ya que se vio muy limitada a tener una educación mejor.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old. She studied until secondary school.  She is married and her husband is a policeman. They have only two daughters, who are in school and who are their only dependents.

Sonia is a house wife.  She receives an income from her husband and remittances that a brother, who resides in the United States, sends her.

She needs the loan she applied for to purchase seven rolls of barbed wire and six pounds of staples to fence land she inherited from her father. She will also pay $150 for a work force and the rest on a loan that is due.  With this loan she will satisfy the need to have her land well  marked by a fence and thus avoid future problems with neighbors.

Sonia’s dream is to have a new house with her husband because the house they live in now was badly constructed and it does not guarantee security for her or her family.  In addition, she dreams of seeing that her daughters study and go on to the university so that they do not experience the financial difficulties that she did when she was young, for she feels extremely limited by not having a better education.

loans.use: to purchase seven rolls of barbed wire and six pounds of staples to fence land she inherited from her father and also pay $150 for a work force and to put the rest on a loan that is due

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 32 years old, married and a resident of Cangmanki, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She earns a living through raising pigs. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative.  Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional feed and piglets.

Jennifer deeply wishes to maintain a good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Ma. Mercedes

texts.en:
Ma. Mercedes requested a PHP 5,000 loan through PMPC to buy more gasoline to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Ma. Mercedes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline to stock and sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 52 years old and married with one child. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as soft-drinks, canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo and noodles to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. 

Thelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soft-drinks, canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Felix

texts.es:
Segundo Felix tiene 32 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a sus 03 hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Conocido en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de cuyes y borregos, también brinda servicios agrícolas en su caserío y anexos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 300 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Felix is 32 years old. He has a partner and lives with his three children in a house he owns in the district of Cayalti, a community engaged in farming, trade and stockbreeding located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Perú.

Known in the area for his work raising and selling guinea pigs and sheep, he also provides farming services in his small village and neighboring communities. He has requested a loan of S/.1,300 from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a larger number of animals and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number of animals and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en: Amiel is 30 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have two children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing for maize production and are waiting for their harvest to be purchased by the buyers. UOB’s clients are benefiting from the production financing. In the past, farmers were suffering significantly during the post-harvest processes, as they waited for buyers to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary, day to day, needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a warehouse/store for maize production.

loans.name: Gabriela De La Paz

texts.es:
Desde muy temprana edad, Gabriela sintió el impulso de  ayudar en la salud de las personas enfermas  recetándoles tratamientos  y medicinas. Su sueño se hizo realidad, porque hoy en día ejerce la profesión de química farmacéutica.  Su experiencia le ha permitido asistir, con sus conocimientos, a muchos pacientes que requieren de sus servicios, orientándolos de una manera eficiente y humana. 
Gracias al apoyo brindado por KIVA Mi Crédito ha logrado abastecer su local con los últimos avances de la medicina.  Sus ventas y  ganancias aumentan debido a ello.   Gabriela desea continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de todos los que visitan su farmacia a diario. Por lo que solicitó un nuevo préstamo con el que comprará  nuevas líneas de  medicamentos.
texts.en:
From a very early age, Gabriela felt the urge to aid in the health of sick people, prescribing them treatments and medications. Her dream came true because now she is in the pharmaceutical profession. Her experience, along with her knowledge, has enabled her to help many patients that require her services, advising them in an efficient and humane manner.

Thanks to the support Kiva Mi Crédito has given, she has stocked her store with the latest advances in medicine. Due to this, her sales and earnings increased. Gabriela hopes to continue satisfying the needs of all who visit her pharmacy daily. That's why she is requesting another loan with which she will buy new lines of medications.

loans.use: to buy new lines of medications.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 31 years old and has five children. Elma is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening, in the Philippines. Elma has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elma has been in pig-fattening for eight years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough shoes and slippers to increase her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva el nombre de Mujeres Trabajadoras  se encuentra en el 2do. Ciclo del programa cuenta con 20 integrantes actualmente , es un grupo muy que se caracteriza por su responsabilidad, solidaridad y ayuda mutua.
 Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Justina de 32 años, tiene una despensa, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ya que siempre va a buscar productos frescos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos frescos. Ella pide este préstamo para poder ampliar su despensa. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, y con lo cual podrán ir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group of women entrepreneurs,with the name Mujeres Trabajadoras [Working Women], is in its 2nd loan cycle of the program and they have 20 members at this time. This is a group characterized by responsibility, solidarity, and mutual help.  

One of the stories worth highlighting is that of Justina, who is 32 years of age.  She has a convenience store where she works every day from very early in the morning. She habitually goes to look for fresh products to be able to offer to her customers.  She is asking for this loan to be able to expand her store.   

They are all grateful for this opportunity through which they will be able to grow.

loans.use: to increase store stocks.

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Simatauca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE SIMATAUCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea ella es conviviente y tiene 39 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura y ganadería, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papas,maíz y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar  su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de animales, negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong the to communal bank “TRES DE MAYO DE SIMATAUCA” which is located in the district of Chinchero, province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

Member Andrea lives in a common law relationship, is 39 years old and has 4 children. She works at her livestock and agricultural businesses and has a plot of land on which she grows potatoes, corn and other vegetables. Andrea works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. and hopes that her businesses will help her get ahead. Her dream is to increase the amount of land she cultivates. Andrea is asking for this loan so she can buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

The other members raise and sell animals, sell livestock, and run a grocery store. Andrea is grateful to those who have taken part in her dream through this organization, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.

loans.name: Ivy Ann

texts.en:
Ivy Ann is a 44-year-old, married resident of Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She earns a living through direct selling.
She has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy shoes, bags and dresses for her direct selling business.

Ivy Ann deeply wishes to remain in good standing, as a member of PMPC.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags and dresses.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to pay her internet and electric bills. Teresita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay internet and electric bills.

loans.name: Valerien

texts.en:
Valerien is 31 years old. He is married with six children. 

This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top-up loan for farmers who have received Agric Production financing for maize production and are now waiting for their harvest to be bought. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing which is encouraging significantly their yield or production. During the time of the post-harvest processes more are suffering poverty as they have to wait the buyer to pay them. 

This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge by solving Valerien's primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for a warehouse and store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, two of which are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rith has a general store business in the Philippines. Rith requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Rith has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her other children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 46 years old, married with four children. She is a very supportive wife and mother to her family. Marcela has a farmland where the crops are corn, cassava and vegetables. The farmland of corn production is the primary source of income for their livelihood. Since Marcela has been a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative for two years, she borrowed a loan amount of PHP 12,000 with the purpose of buying fertilizer for the crops on the farmland. Marcela will be using the farmland to uplift them from poverty and for the improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn farm production

loans.name: Jezel

texts.en:
Jezel is from Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva. She is 44 years old and married, with five school-aged children. 

In 2013, Jezel applied for her membership with PMPC. After hearing about all of the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains her status as a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Now, Jezel is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional feed and piglets. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all of her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is a 42-year-old widow who has seven children, four of whom are already married and three of whom are school age. Bernadeth lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City and fish vending is her way of living. She availed herself of a PHP 20,000 loan for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is 62 years old, widowed and living in Brgy. Banglay, Tangub City. She is a farmer as a source of income. Dionesia is a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative for this year. She borrowed money with a loan amount of PHP 7,000 to buy fertilizer for her corn production. She is hoping that the corn production will be harvested for more and more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn production

location.town: Tangub - Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 25 years old and has three children. She is married, and one child is currently in school. Elsie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Elsie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

She has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, beers, and snack foods. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Evelyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, beers, and snack foods.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and married with four children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from Videoke machine rental.

Marilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Marina works hard to support her family.

She has a candle making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. 

Marina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wax, cord, etc. for her candle making business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wax, cord, etc. for her business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Pacita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Pacita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean De Dieu is 29 years old. He is married with two children. This is a new loan product for UOB. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan is a top up loan for farmers who have received Agric Production financing for maize production and that are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing during the post-harvest processes as they have to wait for the buyers to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day to day needs during the post-harvest period.

loans.use: To pay for construction of a warehouse/store for maize produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor to prepare the land to plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy broilers and to buy materials to build the chicken coop: metal sheets, wood and mesh bags.

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
José tiene 66 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado en la escuela debido a que sus padres no se interesaron por su estudio, en la actualidad está acompañado, de cuatro hijos que procrearon ninguno vive con ellos todos están acompañados y viven aparte, sus compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido de animales de corral.

José se dedica a la agricultura, él cultiva sorgo , maíz , y sandia , estas tres variedades las siembra desde  más o menos unos 15 años,  años atrás trabajó en una fábrica donde elaboraban zapatos pero debido a que tenía donde cultivar y que se vive mejor en el campo decidió migrar al cantón, el lugar donde trabaja está a un kilómetro de su casa.


El crédito solicitado lo invertirá para comprar un sistema de riego que lo instalará para que cuando no llueva el cultivo no sufra, que tenga la opción de regar, así estará asegurando que la inversión que haga puede ser aprovechada y asegurara la alimentación de su esposa porque tendrá los granos básicos. 


Su sueño más grande es tener su equipo de bombeo disponible para poder cultivar otras hortalizas y comer verduras sanas en su familia  pero solo puede lógralo si es apoyado con el préstamo.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old. He studied as far as the second grade in school, since his parents didn't take an interest in his schooling. He is now married, and of his four children, none live with them; they all are married and live on their own. His wife does the domestic chores and cares for the farmyard animals. 

José works in agriculture, growing sorghum, corn, and watermelon. He has been planting these three crops for about 15 years. Years ago he worked in a factory that made shoes, but since he had a place to grow crops, and life is better in the countryside, he decided to move to the canton. The place where he works is one kilometer from his house.

He will invest the requested loan in buying an irrigation system, which he will install so that the crops don't suffer when it doesn't rain. He will have the option to water them, and so he will be making sure that he will be able to take advantage of his investment and make sure his wife has food, because he 
will have basic grains. 

His biggest dream is to have his pumping equipment available so that he can grow other vegetables and so his family can eat healthy vegetables. But he can only achieve this if he has the support of the loan.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation system for his crop

loans.name: Maota

texts.en: Maota is a 56-year-old widow with seven children. She has a small plantation and sells taro and bananas in her community and has been doing this for three years. Maota has requested a loan to buy a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, a new machete, chemicals, and sprayers. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maota will be able to support her business and also her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, a new machete, chemicals, and sprayers

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama mujeres luchadoras, ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres luchadoras que trabajan para poder mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo de cada una de ellas. Están ya en su tercer ciclo del programa de comité, y aparte de ello también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Myrian es una de ellas, trabaja en la costura y comenta que se fue abriendo camino y ya es muy conocida en el barrio por el excelente trabajo que siempre hace y que deja muy conforme a sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener un mejor taller y el día de mañana poder emplear a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, de manera a poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Luchadoras (Hardworking Women) because that is what they are - hardworking women that strive to improve their lives through the work of each individual. They are already in their third cycle of the committee program, and besides that, they are also doing the survey to eliminate poverty. 

Myrian is one of them, she works as a seamstress and mentions that she started little by little and now is well-known in the neighborhood for the excellent work she always does and because her customers always go away happy. Her goal is to be able to have a better workshop and in the future be able to employ other people. 

She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and more, so she can continue to work and strive to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and more.

loans.name: Melopeta

texts.en:
Melopeta is a 22-year-old woman who is married, with three children. She has a small flea market business. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Melopeta needs a loan to buy earrings, Samoan bangles, tapa, cava bowls, printed shirts, shorts, and elei-printed material. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

Melopeta joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy earrings, Samoan bangles, tapa, cava bowls, printed shirts, shorts, and elei-printed material.

loans.name: Irene De La Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra Irene de la Concepcion es profesora de educacion primaria en una escuela publica rural desde hace 10 años impartiendo sus enseñanzas a niños de entre 10 a 15 años, la Sra Irene viaja desde muy temprano 6:00 am terminando sus labores a las a su centro de trabajo 1:00 pm de lunes a viernes.
La Sra. Irene Esta solicitando este credito para la compra materiales de contruccion para mejorar su casa de habitacion y darle una mejor comodidad a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Irene de la Concepcion has been a primary school teacher at a rural public school for 10 years.  She teaches students between the ages of 10 and 15. Irene travels from very early in the morning at 6:00 am and finishes her work with them at her workplace at 1:00 pm from Monday through Friday. 

Irene is asking for this loan for the purchase of construction materials to improve her house so she and her family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, zinc, beams, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Antonieta se sigue dedicando al negocio de fotocopiadora, la socia ya tiene varios anos en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonieta continues with her photocopying business.  She has been in this business for several years, and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to expand her photocopying business.

She is requesting the loan to buy paper.  She is happy with the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy paper.

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONFIANZA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elida ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de animales, negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member of this group belong to the communal bank "CONFIANZA"; this bank is located in the district of Chinchero, part of the Urubamba province and the Cusco department. 

The member is Elida. She lives with her partner, and she is 34 years old with 2 children. She works in her grocery store, and she also makes a living by selling trout. She sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8am until 6pm, and she has already been working at her business for one year, and it has gone very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. The member is requesting the loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 

The other members sell animals and cattle, and they have grocery stores. The member thanks those who form a part of this dream through this medium, and she promises to pay her quotas on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Concepcion Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PROMIVIENDO DE URUBAMBA el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia tiene 76 años de edad y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de producto como arroz, azúcar leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parar de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the communal bank "Promiviendo de Urubamba", and the bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, and in the department of Urubamba.

The member is 76 years old, and she is a widow. She alternates between her daily chores and her grocery store business. She has spent a while making a living with her business, which has gone well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business every day. She sells different types of products such as rice and sugar, among others. 

The member wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase rice and sugar, among other products. She is grateful for the credit, and she promises to pay back her established quotas.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar, among other products.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata vive en la ciudad de nazca, tiene 63 años de edad, pero aun mantiene la alegría y el carisma de una joven de 25 años. Para Fortunata su gran sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, es por ello que con mucho esmero trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas desde hace 3 años, lo cual le ha permitido poder tener un ingreso para salir adelante.

Fortunata esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, realizara refacciones en el techo e su vivienda, entre otros, lo que le permitirá ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fortunata lives in the city of Nazca. She is 63, but still has the happiness and charisma of a young woman of 25. Her great dream is to be able to finish building her house. This is why she has been working for 3 years in her small business selling soft drinks, which has allowed her to earn money to get ahead in life.

Fortunata is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to make improvements to the house where she is living. She plans to make repairs to the roof of the house, amongst other things, which will help to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Ciria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PROMIVIENDO DE URUBAMBA el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia tiene 67 años de edad tiene 03 hijos  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia es profesora cesante, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parar de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el arreglo de una de las habitaciones.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the Promiviendo de Urbubamba communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which is in the province of Urumbamba and the department of Urubamba.

She is 67 years old, and she has 3 children and is single. She alternates between her daily chores, and her business renting rooms. She has made a living through her business for a long while, and it is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business every day.

Currently, the member is an unemployed professor, and she wants to continue working to be able to continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to fix up one of her rooms. She is grateful for the credit, and promises to pay back her established quotas.

loans.use: to fix up one of her rooms.

loans.name: Lilian Lina

texts.es:
Lilian vive en la ciudad de Pisco, es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Tal es así que lilian trabaja como ayudante en un puesto de venta de comida balanceada para animales domésticos desde hace 4 años, ya que este humilde empleo es su única fuente de ingresos para salir adelante y poder sacara delante a su hijo.

Lilian esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, como remodelar el piso y colocar mayólicas, así como tarrajear las paredes de su vivienda; con lo cual podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Lilian lives in the city of Pisco. She is a very hardworking woman--more than anything else she wants to improve her standard of living. She has worked as an assistant in a store selling specialized animal feed for four years. It is a simple job but it is the sole source of income with which she supports her son.

Lilian is grateful to Kiva donors since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to make improvements to the house where she lives like remodeling her floor with cement and thus continue improving her quality of life. She will be able to continue working hard to fulfill her greatest dream: to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: make improvements to her house like remodeling her floor with cement

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is married with three children. Anastacia is 54 years old and lives in Paglaum, Dumalinao, ZDS.
Anastacia sells a blanket and other personal use items to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns fifteen thousand pesos doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 pesos to buy new stocks of her RTW.
Anastacia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Anastacia hopes to have her own stall in town to display her products.

loans.use: To buy new stocks of blankets and other RTW.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 60 years old and married with one child. He works hard to provide for his family. 

He runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, cookies, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Reynaldo has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Reynaldo aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, cookies, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosaline is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosaline has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Rosaline has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Susana has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 49 years old and married, with seven children. With two children currently in school, Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita's business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Amelita has restarted her fish-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Amelita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Amelita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business. She has been in NWTF since 2011 and is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Delia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 48 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elisa has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elisa is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Annalisa and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Annalisa is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Annalisa has been an NWTF borrower since 2010 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Annalisa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with eight children. She is 59 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her dressmaking business and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Carmen has been with NWTF since 2012 in her quest to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 44 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Criselda has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria is 65 years old and widowed with five children. Sheworks hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Patria aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, soft drinks. and other groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Delly

texts.en:
Delly is 54 years old and married, with eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Delly is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Delly has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super-typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her pig-fattening business and she has been in Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) since 2008. 

Elisa is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Elisa will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 48 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Fe has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Fe has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Fe is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que las escuelas quedaban lejos de ellos, en la actualidad está acompañado y tiene diez hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con el los otros están acompañados de los dos que dependen de él solo una estudia es la única que depende en 100%.

Julio trabaja en la agricultura, actividad que hace desde que tenía unos diez años de edad, el trabajo lo aprendió de su papá quien fue exigente con él, su trabajo siempre ha sido este, y le queda a medio kilómetro de la casa, su transporte es un caballo porque el camino es duro y trabaja 6 horas diarias.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono para la milpa, comprará ocho sacos fórmula de 200 libras..

Su sueño más grande es que sus hijos sigan el camino que él les ha enseñado que siempre hagan el bien para que las instituciones crean en la comunidad y así puedan  desarrollar sus actividades y que su hija la que estudia saque siquiera bachillerato porque los demás no han estudiado.
texts.en:
Julio is 50 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school since the schools were far from where he lived. Now he is married and has ten children, of which only two live with him. The others are married. Of the two who depend on him, only one is in school, and she is the only one who is 100% dependent.

Julio works in agriculture, a job he has done since he was about ten years old. He learned this work from his father, who was demanding with him. This has always been his work, and it is half a kilometer from his house. His transportation is a horse, because the road is hard and he works six hours a day. 

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer for his land. He will buy eight 200-pound sacks of formula.

His greatest dream is for his children to follow the path he has showed them, to always do what is right so that institutions grow in the community, and they can do their jobs, and that his daughter who is in school can finish at least secondary school, because the others didn't go to school.

Su sueño más grande es que sus hijos sigan el camino que él les ha enseñado que siempre hagan el bien para que las instituciones crean en la comunidad y así puedan  desarrollar sus actividades y que su hija la que estudia saque siquiera bachillerato porque los demás no han estudiado.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his land. He will buy eight 200-pound sacks of formula.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like one quintal of fertilizer and two quintals of ammonium sulfate, and also to pay for manual labor for the corresponding tasks. She will also pay rent on the land that she farms.

loans.name: Arasi

texts.en: Arasi is a 32-year-old unwed woman with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Arasi has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, a large basin, and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. She will save her earnings in case of an emergency.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, a large basin, and a new oven

loans.name: Lisbeth Marcela

texts.es:
Lisbeth vive en la ciudad de Nazca, trabaja como empleada en una farmacia de su ciudad desde hace 1 año, a su vez tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para poder solventar sus gastos y poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Lisbeth esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar artefactos electrodomésticos para su vivienda como cocina, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir esforzándose para poder salir adelante y hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Lisbeth lives int he city of Nazca. She has been working as an employee in a pharmacy in her city for 1 year. At the same time, she has a small business selling beauty products, so has extra money to be able to cover her expenses and earn a living for herself and her small 5-year-old son.

Lisbeth is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy electrical appliances for her house such as a cooker, amongst other things. In this way, she will be able to improve her quality of life and continue fighting to be able to get ahead and turn her big dream into a reality: providing her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 45 years old and has five children who are in school.

Elizabeth's house was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish-vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Elizabeth is taking out a PHP 5,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build her family a house.

Elizabeth has been with NWTF since 2013, in her pursuit of a rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start, once more, in a new home. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maryjane is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maryjane requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Maryjane has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maryjane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 33 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mylene has been in this business for five years.

In the future Mylene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Wenefreda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Wenefreda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Janet's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what Janet lost. Janet is taking out a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Janet has been with NWTF since 2008 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar su crianza fue lejos de la ciudad debido a eso no tuvo la oportunidad, hoy en día está acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos , bien poco se incorpora a los trabajos del campo, de los hijos solo tres  van a la escuela.

Su negocio es la agricultura, trabajo que hace desde hace mucho tiempo así le enseñaron sus padres y no hay otras fuentes de ingreso solo de la agricultura, la ciudad les queda a unos 20 kilómetros de distancia.

El dinero solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, este producto lo comprará en la ciudad más cerca que la tiene a 20 kilómetros y la calle escabrosa, es así que hasta que tenga el producto en la casa estará satisfecho.

En el futuro su sueño es tener una yunta de bueyes para poder trabajar mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel is 36 years old, and he did not have the opportunity to study because he was raised far away from the city. Now, he is in a relationship, and his life partner takes care of their home, and is slowly incorporating herself in the work in the field. Of their children, only three go to school.

He works in agriculture, a job that he has done for a long time, ever since his parents taught him. There are no other sources of income in the area, just agriculture. The city is about 20 kilometers away.

He needs the money that he is requesting from CrediCampo to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, which he will buy in the nearest city which is 20 kilometers away, with an uneven road. Because of this, he won't be satisfied until he has the product in his house.

In the future, his dream is to have a team of oxen so he can work better.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maa Brundabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Jasobanti is a 27-year-old lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Jasobanti. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. Some years ago, Basanti formed a group with 11 other women from her village with the group name of "Maa Brundabati" self-help group. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc to alleviate their poverty. 

Jasobanti is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. Jasobanti, along with her group, requested a loan of 180,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Luis Baltazar

texts.es:
Luis tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de educación Básica debido a que el lugar donde siempre han vivido está retirado de la ciudad y en ese entonces tenía que viajar hasta la ciudad para seguir estudiando, en la actualidad está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y por días también le ayuda a su compañero de vida en el campo, de él solo depende uno de sus hijos porque el primer hijo vive con sus abuelitos.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos veinte años, sus cultivos son maíz, frijol, y sorgo. Es lo que en la zona se cultiva, el trabajo se lo enseñó su padre quien por toda la vida ha hecho lo mismo, el lugar donde trabaja está cerca a unos 15 minutos de su casa por lo que trabaja seis horas diarias.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar ocho sacos de abono de 200 libras cada uno, es así que le permitirá  realizar su trabajo y  estará cumpliendo su necesidad que tiene, aunque ahora que ya llovió no está nada fácil trasladar este producto por que el camino ya se volvió intransitable pero lo hará cargándolo.

Su sueño es hacer una familia con responsabilidad y con fuerzas de enfrentar los problemas que existen día a día.
texts.en:
Luis is 35 years old. He studied only until third grade because he lived outside the city and in order to study he had to travel to the city. He now has a partner and she is a homemaker and during the day she helps him on the land. They have only one child who is dependent because the first child lives with his grandparents.

Luis has been working in agriculture for about twenty years. He has corn, bean and sorghum crops. This is what is cultivated in the area. His father taught him this work, work his father has done his whole life. His work is about 15 minutes from his house and he works 6 hours per day.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is needed to purchase 8 bags of fertilizer, each one weighing 200 pounds. This will allow him to do his job and fulfill his needs. However, now that it has rained it’s not easy to move this product and the road has become impassable but he will load it.

His dream is to support his family and to have strength to deal with daily problems.

loans.use: to purchase 8 bags of fertilizer, each one weighing 200 pounds

loans.name: Maricela Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maricela tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo año de educación Básica, sus pocos recursos y la distancia de la escuela fueron el factor que no le permitió estudiar más, hoy en día está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, los cuatro hijos que tienen están en la casa y dos de  ellos estudian pues todos dependen en un 100% de Maricela y su pareja. 

El negocio en que Maricela se desempeña es en la agricultura y lo hace desde hace 12 años, cuando se acompañó con su esposo, fue él quien le enseñó cómo se cultiva, antes acompañaba a sus padres pero no de 
lleno pues es un trabajo pesado pero ahora lo hace porque sus hijos necesitan,  también tiene pensado sembrar hortalizas ya que ha sido capacitada para cultivar y lo hará cerca de la casa.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar cuatro sacos de abono que le servirán para fertilizar una hectárea de maíz, así estará mejorando su calidad de vida porque está asegurando que tendrá los granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia.

El sueño de Maricela es que en corto plazo puedan construir su casa, ponerle un techo que por lo menos no se moje ya que son unas de dificultades que ahora tienen y que sus hijos puedan ir a la escuela.
texts.en:
Maricela is 30 years old, and only studied until the second grade due to lack of resources and the distance from the school. She is married, and her husband farms for a living. She has four children, two of whom are in school, and all of whom are fully dependent on her and her husband.

Maricela works is in agriculture, which she has been doing for 12 years. When she married her husband, he taught her how to farm. Previously, she worked with her parents. Her work is hard, but she does it because she needs to support her children. She has also been thinking of growing vegetables because they will be able to grow and she could plant them close to her house.

She needs the loan she is requesting through CrediCampo to buy four bags of fertilizer which she will use to fertilize one acre of corn. This will improve her quality of life because it will ensure that she has basic grains to feed her family.

Maricela’s dream in the short-term is to build her house; to put on a roof to at least keep her family dry, which is one of their current problems. She also wants her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer which she will use to fertilize one acre of corn.

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PROMIVIENDO DE URUBAMBA el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia tiene 57 años de edad tiene 02 hijos  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de  venta de pasto, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego  venderlos a su clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día a su negocio,  la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parar de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pasto.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Promiviendo de Urubamba,” which is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Urubamba.

The member is 57 years old, has two children, and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her grass selling buinsess, and with raising young animals, which she then sells. She enjoys this business, which has done well thanks to her dedication and daily efforts. The member wishes to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy grass. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase grass.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.


Leah requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.


In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Héctor es un hombre de 29 años de edad que vive felizmente con su pareja con la que aspira a tener una linda familia, trabaja como mecánico hace aproximadamente 4 años actividad que aprendió empíricamente a través de la práctica. Ya que es un mecánico que apenas está empezando no tiene muchas herramientas que para él son de vital importancia no solo por el hecho que las tiene que pedir prestadas si no porque realiza servicios a domicilio y sería ideal poder contar con todo el equipo para atender cualquier imprevisto de manera inmediata por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de herramientas cubriendo de gran manera el déficit que tiene, su gran sueño es poder tener un local más amplio con todo el equipo necesario para atender cualquier inconveniente mecánico que le soliciten.
texts.en:
Héctor is 29 and lives happily with his partner, with whom he hopes to start a wonderful family. He has been working as a car mechanic for approximately 4 years, something he learned on the job by doing it. Since he is just starting off as a mechanic, he hasn't got many tools, which are of vital importance to him, not only because he has to borrow them but also because he works from home, and it would be ideal to be able to have all the equipment necessary to sort out any unforeseen problem immediately.

This is why he is asking for a loan to buy tools, which would largely cover his shortfall. His great dream is to be able to have larger premises with all the necessary equipment to sort out any mechanical problem asked of him.
