loans.use: to buy the necessary tools to sort out any unplanned repair required of him.

loans.name: Shiv Shakti Shg Group

texts.en:
Shiv Shakti Self Help Group consists of 13 women from a village in Odisha. They formed this group to help share their problems and solve their problems themselves. One of the members is Surekha who was selected as the president of Shiv Shakti Shg. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Surekha. Surekha is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

Surekha has requested a loan of 195,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 27 years old and has two children. She is married, and her children are in school.

Jannet and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jannet is taking out a housing loan amounting 4500 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011 and plans to recover through her pig fattening business.

With your help, Jannet can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Parlita

texts.en:
Parlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood for manufacturing furniture and pays for laborers' salaries for her furniture-making business.

Parlita has been in this business for 18 years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood for manufacturing furniture and to pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judita is 50 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Judita's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish-vending business and is committed to regain what Judita lost. She is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Judita has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products and farming sugarcane and fruits. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is 45 years old and widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, egg, noodles, etc.

Marlita has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Candy

texts.es:
Candy es un mujer joven, tiene 33 años, es casada y madre de 2 niñas, estudiantes de primaria y secundaria. Su espíritu emprendedor la llevo a aprender costura con una hermana mayor, luego se perfeccionó llevando algunos cursos. Cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en la confección de sus prendas, iniciando con prendas muy sencillas hasta llegar a su fuerte que es la elaboración de pijamas para damas, niñas y niños, además de conjuntos de pantalón corto y blusa para niños. 
Gracias a esta actividad ella puede brindar apoyo con los gastos de estudio de sus hijas, que es lo que representa su salario.  Ella inicia su emprendimiento con capital propio, sin embargo necesita fortalecer su maquinaria y equipo, es por eso que invertirá su financiamiento en la compra de 2 máquinas industriales.  Eso le permitirá agilizar el proceso de producción, y poder dar a basto con los pedidos en un plazo más corto. Su plan a mediano plazo es dedicarse solo a confeccionar y entregar sus creaciones a revendedoras sin tener que salir de su casa, o vender ella misma.
texts.en:
Candy is a young woman of 33 years old, married and the mother of 2 girls who are primary and secondary students. Her entrepreneurial spirit led her to learn sewing with an older sister and she improved after taking some classes. She has 7 years of experience making garments, starting with very simple garments up to her strongpoint which is making pajamas for ladies and children as well as outfits of shorts and blouses for children.

Thanks to this work she is able to afford her daughters´ education expenses, which is what represents her salary. She began her business venture with her own money, but needs to strengthen her machinery and equipment which is why she will invest her funding in the purchase of 2 industrial sewing machines. That will allow her to speed up the production process to be able to keep up with the orders in a shorter time. Her medium- term plan is to work only making and delivering her creations to retailers without having to leave her house or sell them herself.

loans.use: to buy 2 industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Carmen ella es conviviente, tiene 33 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende plátanos, naranja, papaya entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas para su negocio como papayas entre otros. 
Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, guía de turismo, crianza de animales, artesanía, preparación de bocaditos, tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos de belleza.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo. 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Carmen. She is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Carmen divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling fruit at one of the markets in the city. She has been in business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Carmen sells bananas, oranges, papayas, and other fruits. She is a responsible and industrious person, and working in this manner has helped to move her family forward.

Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy fruits for her business, such as papayas and other products. The other members sell clothes, sell cosmetics, act as tour guides, raise animals, produce handicrafts, prepare snacks, manage a grocery store, and sell beauty products. The small photos display two members who requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their work.

Carmen is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy papayas and other fruits for her business.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 51 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera el socio pueda continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento del carro.
El socio se siente agradecido con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal called "Ollantay De Wayracpunco."  The communal bank is located in the Ollantaytambo District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.
The member is 51 years old, has two children and is married.  He mixes his daily activities with making his living in transportation.  He has been in this business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work he puts into it each day.  This member is a responsible and hard-working person.  He wants to able to keep working to continue supporting his family. 
The member is requesting the loan to provide maintenance for his car. 
He feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his established repayment plan.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Emy

texts.en: Emy is 53 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Emy works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. Emy has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Annabelle works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn. Annabelle is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional milk, sugar, fruit, ice cubes, etc. Jasmin has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional milk, sugar, fruit, ice cubes, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 46 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Babina

texts.en:
Babina is 54 years old, married and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Babina has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Babina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ermonedie

texts.en:
Ermonedie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Ermonedie has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Ermonedie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is 37 years old and married with one child. With a child currently in school, Lynn works very hard to provide for them.

Lynn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lynn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lynn has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lynn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her computer shop.  Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood for his business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 01 hijo tiene 69 años de edad y es viuda, la socia alterna  sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos y la venta de chicha ,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería  todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maiz  entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Communal Bank “Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc” which is located in Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco. She is 69 years old, widowed, and has one child. The borrower divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses of selling dried products and selling “chicha” (a traditional beverage made from corn). She has been in these businesses for a long time and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. The borrower sells her merchandise to all of the customers who request them. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy corn and other products. She is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn and other products.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 26-year-old married man from the city of Deir al-Balah. He lives with his wife and one small kid in a simple house. For the past year, Majdi has been working in a grocery store he owns. It is a good business and the only one in his area. Majdi would like to improve his business and expand it in the future. 

Majdi took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more basic grocery products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, 
Majdi will be able to improve his store and increase the volume of sales. 

Majdi appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more basic grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in which she buys and sells fruits in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell for her business.

Jessica has been in this business for five years. Jessica earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Melinda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Obani Francisco

texts.es: Obani es un humilde trabajador del campo que desempeña su actividad hace más de 20 años la cual aprendió por enseñanza de sus padres, trabaja incansablemente para dejarle un futuro asegurado a su hija de 17 años y poder tener un vejez tranquila puesto que tiene 47 años de edad. Debido a los diferentes cambios climáticos que estamos viviendo sus hábitos de cultivo están cambiando por lo que obani tiene que estar preparado para afrontarlos y de alguna manera aprovecharlos por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios para preparar la tierra para el cultivo como lo son semillas, fertilizantes entre otros aprovechando un proverbio que dice que de las peores situaciones se sacan las mejores soluciones e ideas y es lo que obani quiere implementar convirtiendo un problema global en un beneficio propio
texts.en:
Obani is a humble field worker who has been working for more than 20 years. He learned this trade from his parents. Obani works tirelessly so that he can provide a secure future for his 17-year-old daughter and have a peaceful retirement, since he is currently 47 years of age.

Due to the various weather changes, the conditions for growing crops are changing as well. For this reason, Obani must be prepared to confront these conditions and somehow adapt to them. This is why he is requesting a loan. Obani will buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, and other items so that he can prepare the land for his crops . He plans to follow the proverb that says that the worst situations bring about the best solutions and ideas. Obani hopes to turn this global problem into his own benefit.

loans.use: to pay for irrigation, compost, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 46-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nora's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Nora is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Nora has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a boarding house business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional wood, paints, nails, etc. for the repair of her business.

Lorna has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, paints, nails, etc. for the repair of her business.

loans.name: Mersita

texts.en:
Mersita is 44 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Mersita and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Mersita is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mersita has been an NWTF borrower since 2008 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Mersita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Edisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Edisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa works hard to support her family. Marisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing like gasoline, a fishing net, etc.

Marisa has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for fishing, such as gasoline, a fishing net, etc

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Riza works very hard to provide for them.

Riza's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Riza has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Riza has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Riza is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her pig fattening and been in NWTF since 2008 and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Salvacion will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lua`a Group

texts.en: This group is called Lua'a. It consists of five women, who are all hardworking. They live in Aden, Yemen. They have taken out a loan of 350,000 YER. Faizah is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 6 years old, and the youngest is two years old. She studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. She is very active, a dynamic woman. She has a strong determination to take care of her children. Her husband is the sole breadwinner for the family. Recently, he has been unable to look after the family. Faizah decided to help him to cover the  family expenses. She started out with a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Faiza invested that money in her own business. She started that business two years ago, selling ready-made women’s clothes in order to provide for the family. She sees this business as profitable for her. Faiza is very grateful and thankful for Kiva's lenders for her first loan. That loan helped her to improve her business. For further expansion, Faiza has applied for a second loan, of 80,000 YER, from AMB, in order to buy more ready-made women’s clothes to resell them to the women in her area. Faiza looks forward to expanding her business by opening a large store to sell ready-made clothes. She hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready- made women's clothes and resell them to the women in her area.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila, age 41, is happy tending her little store. She is married with two kids, and her husband is a farmer. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Nila keeps on running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. Nila believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain the business and beat the competition.  

Nila has reached her fourth year as a member of PMPC. She has applied for a loan of 14,900 PHP for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "It's already tested," she says. She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anne Jane

texts.en:
Anne Jane is 26 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She plants a variety of flowers. 

Anne Jane wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her flower crop

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en: Magdalina is 60 years old. She is married to a farmer. Both of them cultivate their land through planting corn. They live in Del Pilar, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. They help each other in cultivating the land so that they can provide for their basic needs. Because their income is not enough, they have decided to join PMPC so that they can borrow additional capital for their corn production in the amount of 5,000 PHP. The profit they earn from their production they will save with PMPC for their retirement.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has been in NWTF since 2011 and has restarted her business. She is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Purisima will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Purisima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her sewing business.

Norma has been in this business for 35 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Perpetua has been in this business for ten years. Perpetua earns more income from a water refilling station.

Perpetua has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 34 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc., to sell.

Rose has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients, such as rice, sugar, coconut milk, etc., for her food production business.

Rosita has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as rice, sugar, coconut milk, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 60 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Tomasa's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Tomasa has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Tomasa has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Tomasa is committed to rebuild her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children, six of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Elvira successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Nellides

texts.es:
Nellides es una mujer luchadora y con muchas ganas de vivir y salir adelante.
Ella sufre de una situación de discapacidad que le dificulta su movilidad y por lo tanto se le hace difícil realizar muchas labores.
Pero eso no es suficiente para detener a esta imparable mujer que con toda su fuerza de voluntad logro consolidar un negocio de venta de variedades y miscelánea en su propia casa. Desde allí atiende sus clientes con ayuda de su hija y esposo, éstos han sido un gran apoyo para ella y su desarrollo como persona.
Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de productos como ropa, accesorios, útiles escolares, entre otros, para abastecer sus vitrinas y exhibidores.
De esta manera ella va tener la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y tener un mayor número de ventas.
Con los ingresos obtenidos podrá ayudar económicamente en su casa.
texts.en:
Nellides is a courageous woman who is eager to live and get ahead. 

She suffers from a disability that hinders her mobility and she therefore finds it difficult to perform many tasks. But that's not enough to stop this unstoppable woman with all her willpower. She managed to start a business selling miscellaneous items in her home. From there she is able to serve her customers with the help of her husband and daughter. They have both been a great support to her and to her development as a person. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of products such as clothes, accessories, and school supplies among other things, to furnish her shop windows and displays. This way she will have the opportunity to capitalize on her business and have more sales. She can can help financially at home with the proceeds she will receive.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories to furnish her shop windows and increase her sales.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: Genelita is 64 years old, married, and a resident of Del Pilar, Calamba, Philippines. She is blessed with four children. Because it is hard for them to survive, she decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with a capital of 3,000 PHP. Her primary customers are her neighbors. She was able to manage the store successfully, and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which she joined in 2008. She was able to avail herself of ten loans,  which she repaid religiously. Now, she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods and beverages for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to purchase stocks such as canned goods and beverages for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pig of a new sort and also a lot of fodder for all her pigs.

loans.name: Miriam Consuelo

texts.es: Miriam es una emprendedora la cual inicio con su negocio aproximadamente un mes, tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual distribuye productos de aseo, refrescos, legumbre, frituras y comidas que ella misma prepara. Adquirió los conocimientos para manejar el local ya que anteriormente manejaba negocio similares y al ver que eran muy rentables decidió montar su propio negocio el cual le ha traído muy buenos beneficios por lo que quiere implementar productos que lo hagan más llamativo como iniciar con la distribución de cerveza y otras marcas de refrescos para complacer a todo tipo de cliente que se le acerque, Miriam afirma que este crédito será de gran ayuda ya que podrá posicionarse y competir a la par con otras tiendas del sector, su gran sueño es poder montar una cadena de negocios complementarios como una legumbrera y carnicería  para aumentar sus ingresos y tener una vida más tranquila dado que tiene 52 años de edad
texts.en: Miriam is a businesswoman who started her business about a month ago.  She has a small store where she sells toiletries, beverages, vegetables, fried foods, and food that she prepares herself.  She knows how to run a store, because previously she used to manage a similar business.  Seeing that it was very profitable, she decided to start up her own business and it has brought her very good benefits.  This is why she wants to stock up with products that will make her store more appealing.  For example, she wants to start selling beer and other brands of soft drinks to please any type of customer that comes to her store.  Miriam states that this loan will be a great help to her, because she will be able to position herself and compete head to head with the other stores in her neighborhood.  Miriam's great dream is to be able to start up a chain of complementary businesses, such as a vegetable store and a meat store, so that she could increase her income and have a more tranquil life, as she is 52 years old.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of soft drinks and beer to better compete with other stores in the area

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is a 30-year-old single woman with one child. She runs a small business selling ice pops and popcorn in her community; she has been doing this for five years.

Fenumiai has requested a loan to buy popcorn seeds, cooking oil, a deep pot, cordials, a large cooler and a bag of sugar. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fenumiai will be able to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy popcorn seeds, cooking oil, a deep pot, cordials, a large cooler and a bag of sugar

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia is a 49-year-old married woman with 5 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. Valelia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a tiller, a crowbar and a sprayer. The remaining amount from the loan will be used to renovate her house, buying items such as iron roofing sheets and bags of cement. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. With her profits, Valelia hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, gloves, a tiller, a crowbar, and a sprayer, and to buy items to renovate her house.

loans.name: Atene

texts.en: Atene is a 22-year-old unwed woman with three children. She has a small vegetable garden and sells cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers in her community. She has been doing this for two years. Atene has requested a loan to buy insect poison, a new hose, screen wire, a tiller and a machete. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Atene will be able to support her family daily.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, a new hose, screen wire, a tiller and a machete

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 46 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Luzviminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products like canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent, soap, and shampoo to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 11 years and sells a wide variety of items. 

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her children are currently in school.

Mary is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary has been pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 36 years now.

Dulce requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace, age 30, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children, two of whom attend school. She sells bicycle spare parts, a business she started in 2005 to generate family income. She desires to expand her business. Price fluctuations hinder her business.

She is acquiring a loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is a 53- year-old unwed woman with six children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for nine years. Sosefina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers and a wheelbarrow. The remaining amount of her loan will be used to renovate her house, buying items such as cement and timber
. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. With her profits, Sosefina hopes to build a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers and a wheelbarrow, plus cement and timber to renovate her house.

loans.name: Quilla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QUILLA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina tiene 73 años de edad tiene 07 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia elabora desayunos y almuerzos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante, artesania, venta de comida, maestro constructor.
texts.en:
Paulina belongs to the communal bank QUILLA. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco Department.
Paulina, the client, is 73 years old and has 7 children. She is a widow. She alternates her daily activities with a restaurant business. She prepares breakfast and lunch. She takes good time working on her business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in everyday. She wishes to continue working to support her family.
The client is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, rice, and more. 
The client is grateful for the loan being granted and agrees to meet her repayment quotas. The members who appear in the attached picture requested to be late for the meeting because of work.
The other members are in the businesses of restaurants, crafts, food sales, and construction.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, rice, and more.

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en: Izabella lives in Yerevan with her husband and daughter. She took a loan last year and was able to pay for her daughter Elina's university tuition. She was a very responsible borrower and has already paid that loan back. She has now applied for another loan to be able to pay for Elina's education this year. Izabella will be very grateful to receive lenders' support this time also.

loans.use: to pay her daughter Elina's university tuition

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en: Yasinta is a produce dealer in Hoima, Uganda. She sells cassava, maize, beans and rice and works six days a week. She is 34 years old, and single with two children, aged 16 and 12 and both attend school. Yasinta started her business in 2009 to boost the family income. She intends to expand her income base. However, seasonal changes hinder her business. She will use the money to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sowed

texts.en: Sowed, aged 42, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with six children aged between 8 and 18, and all attend school. He deals in hardware and spare parts for bicycles and also does farming. He started his business in 2004. He started as a boda-boda rider, saved money, and then started his current business. He desires to educate all his children, to build for them a good house, and to buy a car. Debtors affect his business as they take a long time to pay. He is acquiring this credit to restock spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles.

loans.use: to restock spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John lives in Hoima, Uganda and is a father of three, two of whom attend school. He is a boda-boda rider and works seven days a week. He earns additional income from a retail shop. He started his business in 2001. He hopes to increase stock in his retail shop. Bad weather hinders his business. He is acquiring a loan to buy windows for his house.

loans.use: to buy windows for his house.

loans.name: Jaime Andres

texts.es:
El señor Jaime es uno más de esos campesinos que trabajan nuestros campos y nos enseñan el valor de la humildad y el trabajo duro.
Desde siempre ha realizado labores de agricultura aprendiendo de diferentes oficios gracias a sus padres quienes desde pequeño le enseñaron a defenderse.
El dese iniciar un negocio de cría de cerdos de levante y engorde púes siente la necesidad de obtener ingresos para su familia y gracias a su experiencia seguramente tendrá éxito en su proyecto.
El tiene mucha fe en su actividad y solicita un auxilio monetario para comprar algunos cerdos y crías para comenzar con su producción.
Tiene grandes sueños como el de formar un negocio grande, sostenible y que genere empleo.
texts.en:
Jaime is one of those farmer who works the fields and teaches the values of humility and hard work. 
He has always performed agricultural work, learning different trades thanks to his parents who taught him to take care of himself from an early age.
He wanted to start a business breeding and fattening pigs. He feels the need to earn income for his family. Through his experience, he will surely succeed in his project.
He has great faith in his activities and requests a loan to buy some pigs to start production.
He has big dreams such as forming a large, sustainable business and create jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single, hardworking woman who lives in Hoima, Uganda. She runs a bar business she started in 2012 to generate family income. She desires to expand the business and open another branch. Bad weather hinders her business. She is acquiring a loan to begin constructing a foundation for her house.

loans.use: to begin constructing a foundation for her house.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer lives in Yerevan with her husband and two children. She runs a small store where she trades with bags. Over the years of hard work, Varditer has been able to have a successful and profitable business. She has requested this loan to purchase new stocks of bags for her store. Varditer has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her retail business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Varditer has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of bags.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is from Vayk town, which is located in Vayots Dzor region. Anahit lives there with her mother. She has kept her family farm for many years. It includes only three cows and three calves.  Anahit has applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to ask for financial support and to enlarge her farm. She needs the loan to purchase two oxen, a calf and one cow. This is her second loan that has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. She took a loan before but wasn't able to pay it back on time, because of very difficult financial conditions. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful, and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anahit has been approved for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, a calf and one cow.

loans.name: Narlluri

texts.es: Narlluri es una mujer emprendedora la cual no se detiene ante ninguna adversidad, inicio con un negocio de venta de productos pro catalogo y al ver que con este negocio no alcanzaba a generar los ingresos suficientes para colaborar con los gastos del hogar junto a la corporación interactuar decidió iniciar un negocio de venta mercancía, como ropa para hombre y dama y ropa interior en el afán de brindar el dinero suficiente en su hogar a sus 27 años de edad sueña con tener un negocio consolidado que le represente buenos ingresos poder conocer una pareja con la cual tener una familia y que ella pueda sentirse útil al brindar capital acabando con ese ego machista que aún en esta época se vive. Solicita un credito par ala compra de ropa de hombre y dama, ropa interior o lo que le solicite sus clientes.
texts.en: Narlluri is an enterprising woman which does not stop because of any adversity. She started a business selling products by catalog. Seeing that this business was not enough to generate income to help with household expenses, she decided to start  business selling merchandise such as men and women's underwear in an effort to provide enough money for the home. She is 27 and dreams of having an established business that represents good income so she can have a family. She can feel useful by providing an equal contribution and stop the macho attitude that still exists in this era. She has applied for a loan to buy men and women's clothing, underwear, or what her customers demand.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
La Señora Daisy es una persona emprendedora ya que con esfuerzo y desempeño a salido adelante, tiene 40 años de edad, convive con sus 2 hijas y su compañero de hogar,su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, cuenta con más de 2 año de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela siendo estos vecinos de la misma aldea y comunidades aledañas, con el crédito que esta solicitando le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros. Ella desea comprar productos como manteca, lacteos, pollo, frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, jugos, frescos, churros y otros productos para su venta.
Doña Daisy su sueño es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijas y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, y así sentir el apoyo
que prisma y kiva le estaría dando.

Trojes - Abril 2014
texts.en:
Daisy is an enterprising person who through effort and performance has gotten ahead. She is 40 years old and lives with her two children and her partner. She sells basic food items. She has been doing this for two years and has a good clientele who are her neighbors in her community and the surrounding villages. She will use the loan she is requesting to help her have a better stocked business. This will allow an increase in her revenues so she can cover the family expenses and other financial obligations. She wants to buy products like margarine, dairy products, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, juices, soft drinks, churros and other products for sale. Daisy's dream is to provide her children with good professional education and improve the living conditions of herself and her family. With the help that she will receive from the loan she will be able to realize her dreams and feel the support that Prisma and Kiva are offering her.
Trojes - April 2014.

loans.use: to buy margarine, dairy products, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, juices, soft drinks, churros and other products for sale.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is a student from Yerevan. She is a mother of two children. Her son is a student at Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture. Lusine is a Kiva borrower. She took a loan last year and was able to pay for her son, Aramayis's, university tuition. Lusine will be very thankful if lenders support her one more time and give her an opportunity to pay for his son's university tuition for this year.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Ar-Jean

texts.en: Ar-Jean is 24 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.  She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm.  Ar-Jean has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Alida

texts.en: Alida lives in Mets Ayrum village in Lori region. She lives there with her husband (in the photo) and two children ages 10 and 3 years old.  Alida's husband is a village head. The family also runs a farm. They keep pigs and also have peach orchard. Alida and her husband have been running a farm for 13 years already, and they are successful farmers in the region. They also have a harvester, which reaps their own land, as well as some lands of neighboring villages. The requested loan of USD 2,000 will be a big support for Alida to be able to invest in her farm. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds, fuel and forage. Please help her to make her goals come true.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, fuel and forage.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa lives in Ashnak village with her husband. The couple has been involved in agriculture for many years. Their farm includes livestock (7 cows, 90 sheep and 30 chickens) and arable land. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Larisa's farm. She plans to purchase 10 piglets, forage and a harvester for land cultivation. 

As a successful farmer, she ensures monthly payments on time and hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for ten piglets, forage and a harvester.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: A teacher by profession, Anna has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. She lives with her husband, 9-year-old daughter, and in-laws. The whole family helps Anna with farming. The requested loan of USD 2,500 is very important for Anna and her farm. She plans to purchase forage and cover land cultivation costs. Please help Anna to develop her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage and cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

Divina has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 54 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, etc.

Enriqueta has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Enriqueta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lulo (naranjilla) seeds and inputs to maintain the land.

loans.name: Nelly Del Rosario

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de educación básica , hoy está acompañada desde hace 17 años pero no ha podido tener ningún hijo, por lo que su diversión es trabajar con su esposo en el campo y los quehaceres del hogar y viven solos.

Su negocio es trabajar en la agricultura, ella sabe cultivar todo tipo de semillas así como hacer abono orgánico para el cultivo que hacen, por el momento no tiene otra actividad económica, el trabajo le queda cerca de la casa a unos 20 minutos por lo que a pie se va todos los días.

Con el préstamo comprará cerdos para la crianza y luego venderlos ya que quiere aprovechar que tiene el tiempo suficiente para cuidar unos cuantos cerdos y buscar una ganancia.

Su sueño más grande tener  un hijo, y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is 35 years old and studied up to Grade 2. She has been in a common-law relationship for 17 years but they have not been able to have children. So she occupies herself with working with her husband in the fields and doing the housework. They live alone. Her business is farming. She knows how to grow all types of seeds as well as make organic manure to use on their crops. At this time she has no other economic activity. Their work is nearby, about 20 minutes away. So they walk there every day.

She will buy pigs with the loan to raise them and later sell them. She wants to take advantage of having enough time to care for some pigs and make a profit. Her greatest dream is to have a child and to make improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Seynabou, âgée de 29 ans, évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle adore ce métier et a très tôt arrêté les études pour s’adonner à cette activité. Elle avait récupéré une tontine qui lui a permis de démarrer son commerce et maintenant, elle fonctionne avec ce fond. 
Célibataire, Seynabou a un objectif, celui d’avoir ses propres biens tirés à la sueur de son front. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce crédit afin d’acheter du sable, du ciment, du zinc et du fer et pouvoir construire petit à petit son terrain. Avec les revenus tirés de son commerce, elle pourra rembourser ce crédit sans problème.
Seynabou rêve de devenir une grande commerçante et d’ouvrir un magasin pour mettre sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Seynabou is 29 years old and she has been working as a retailer for more than seven years.  She loves her job and actually quit school early to get involved in her activity.  She started her business by taking a loan from a communal bank and she's still using the same capital to finance her business.

Seynabou is single and her goal is to work very hard in order to acquire a few things.  To this end, she is requesting a loan to buy some sand, cement, zinc and iron, which will allow her to gradually build on her plot of land.  With the profits from her business, she will be able to repay her loan without any difficulty.  Her dream is to become a major retailer and to open a shop where she would be able to display her goods.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand and zinc to build her house.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es soltero, tiene 26 años, nació en la localidad de El Carmen de la provincia Obispo Santisteban y actualmente vive con sus tíos en la localidad de Montero del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia. Él trabaja como Inspector Municipal en el Gobierno Municipal de Montero 
A Reinaldo siempre le gustó mucho los números y todo lo que tenga que ver con las finanzas y además  piensa que el mundo de las finanzas crece a pasos agigantados todos los días y es un campo donde siempre hay oportunidades buenas en el área laboral, por ese motivo decidió estudiar la carrera de Contaduría Pública y con mucho sacrificio por la distancia de su casa a la universidad, logró culminar sus años de estudio faltándole muy poco para concluir su carrera, su mayor obstáculo es el factor económico pues él aparte de pagar sus gastos, necesita ayudar económicamente a sus padres que viven en el campo y no tienen muy buenos ingresos. Por este motivo Reinaldo solicita un crédito educativo para financiar sus estudios y culminar su carrera, pues está seguro que con esta oportunidad podrá ver cumplido el primero de sus sueños, pues otro de ellos es trabajar en el área financiera de una empresa petrolera y crear su propia empresa de servicios contables. Reinaldo nos cuenta que se encuentra muy contento y agradecido de saber que existen personas dispuesta a ayudar a otros y los alientan al mismo tiempo a no conformarse con poco si no que hacen también que sus aspiraciones como persona y profesional sigan creciendo día a día.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is single and 26 years old. He was born in El Carmen in the province of Obispo Santisteban and now lives with his uncle in the community of Montero in Santa Cruz Department of Bolivia. He works as a municipal inspector for the municipal government of Montero. Reinaldo always liked numbers a lot and everything to do with finance. He also feels that the financial world grows in large steps every day. Plus it is a field with good employment opportunities.

So he decided to study to become a Public accountant. With a lot of sacrifice due to the distance of the university from his house, he has managed to finish the years of study with only a little bit left to complete his studies. His main obstacle is financial. Besides paying for his expenses he needs to help his parents financially as they live in the country and do not have much income.

For this reason Reinaldo is requesting an educational loan to finance his studies and complete his degree. He is certain that with this opportunity he will be able to achieve the first of his dreams. Another of his dreams is to work in the financial section of a petroleum company and create his own business offering accounting services. Reinaldo tells us that he is very happy and grateful to know that there are people who are willing to help others and encourage them at the same time to not accept mediocrity but grow their personal and professional desires each day.

loans.use: to pay for the last year of his Public Accountant studies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from lumber. 

Vilma is borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar and milk for her food vending business.

Vilma has sustained her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia, 45, is married with five children. Two of her children are currently in school. 

Eugenia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Eugenia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like  to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Cristobal Rufino

texts.es:
Al entrar  en la pulpería de Cristobal te da la sensación de que no hace falta nada, porque  cada  stand  se encuentra lleno de  todos los productos que más consumen sus visitantes.  Desde hace cinco años posee su propio negocio,  gracias a su esfuerzo y a su buena administración los resultados han sido positivos y se logran ver a simple vista. Además del  comercio, Milton también ejerce un cargo de contador para una  constructora.
El desea mantener este mismo ritmo de ventas. Asimismo, ofrecerle  al  público  variedad y los mejores productos, por lo que  solicitó  un préstamo en KIVA Mi Crédito para la compra  de granos básicos, aceite, dulces, condimentos y enlatados,  artículos que tienen más alto consumo. Entre sus planes futuros esta ampliar su pulpería con muchos stands,  hasta lograr convertirla en un mini supermercado.
texts.en:
When entering Cristobal’s store, one gets the feeling that there is nothing missing because each shelf is full of all of the products that the visitors consume.  He has had his own business for five years. The results have been positive, thanks to his efforts and good management and because his products are easy to spot.  Besides selling, Milton also works as an accountant for a construction company.

He wants to keep the same rate of sales, as well as offering a variety and better products to the public, so he is asking for a Kiva/Mi Credito loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, candy, condiments, canned goods, and high consumption products.  His future plans include expanding his store with many shelves until he has a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1992 году. Фарзона замужем и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Ее муж следователь. Фарзона занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она предоставляет услуги швеи более 4 лет. Фарзона и ее муж стараются воспитать своего ребенка в духе патриотизма, а также создать все необходимое условия. Фарзона должна провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для проведения церемония обрезания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farzona is a conscientious, hardworking woman.  She was born in 1992, and is currently married and raising a son.  Her husband works in law enforcement as an investigator, whereas Farzona works as a seamstress, and has been doing so for more than 4 years.   Farzona and her husband are trying to instill a sense of cultural & national pride in their son as they raise him, in addition to providing for his basic daily needs.  She needs to prepare for her son's circumcision ceremony, but doesn't have enough money to do so.  As such, she's requesting a loan of 5000 somoni, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: make preparations for her son's circumcision ceremony

loans.name: Diego Antonio

texts.es: Diego ha sido un conductor por muchos años, se dedica a transportar mercancía o realizar acarreos, esta actividad la ha desempeñado por muchos años y gracias a esta ha podido tener una vida tranquila con su esposa y dos hijos a sus 47 años de edad Diego tiene mucho que agradecerle a su carro y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para realizar mejoras al vehículo que tantos años le dio de comer, reformas como latonería y pintura en forma de agradecimiento y respeto a su herramienta de trabajo que le dará sustento por muchos años.
texts.en: Diego has been a driver transporting merchandise and hauling for many years. This work has served him well for many years and it has allowed him to lead a peaceful life with his wife and two children.  At age 47, he has much to thank his car for and for this reason he is asking for a loan to make improvements to his vehicle such as brass work and painting to show appreciation and respect for this work tool which has sustained him and provided him with food for many years.

loans.use: to make alterations to his vehicle such as brass work and painting

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de maíz y habas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar abono entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina continues to sell corn and beans and has been doing this for years.  Things are going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her business each day.  She is a responsible person who wants to continue working so she can continue to support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy compost and other things.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven madre soltera que ha dedicado parte de su vida a la crianza y educación de su hija de 13 años. Ella trabaja todos los días realizando actividades campestres como agricultura, pero últimamente se ha dedicado más a la cría y venta de pollos de engorde.
Ella tiene un galpón instalado a un costado de su vivienda, allí alberga una cantidad moderada de pollos que posteriormente vende a las personas de la vereda y en la plaza de mercado.
Es muy trabajadora y no teme a ensuciarse las manos con tal de conseguir el sustento para su hija.
Ella solicita dinero para inyectarle capital a su negocio y comprar mayor cantidad de huevos y gallinas ponedoras, de esta forma podrá aumentar su nivel de producción teniendo un mejor nivel de ingresos para cubrir todos los gastos básicos en su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es poder ofrecerle a su hija una educación de calidad para que más adelante sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young single mother who has raised and educated her 13 year old daughter.  She does work in the fields, such as farming, every day, but lately she has been raising and selling chickens.

She has a coop set up at her home and has a small number of chickens there that she will later sell in the market plaza.

She is very hardworking and is not afraid to get her hands dirty to support her daughter.  She is asking for money to buy eggs and laying hens in quantity.  This way she will be able to increase her production and have a better income with which to cover her basic household expenses.

Her greatest dream is to be able to provide her daughter with a quality education so she can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy eggs and chickens.

loans.name: Rufino Alfredo

texts.es:
Rufino tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, sus padres no pudieron ponerlo a la escuela pues eran muy pobres. Él está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al oficio doméstico tiene 3 hijos los cuales uno es agricultor y los demás están en la escuela, en casa de Rufino viven 5 personas y todos dependen de él.

Rufino es agricultor, se ha dedicado toda su vida al cultivo de maíz y frijol entre otros. El trabajo lo aprendió desde que era pequeño su familia a eso de dedicaba y el aprendió de ellos.   Él tiene otra actividad económica cuando no está trabajando en lo propio trabaja de jornal para quien lo busque es un ingreso mas que tiene. El trabajo del cliente está a pocos minutos de su casa la dificultad que tiene es llevar los insumos hasta su domicilio pues recorre 34 kilómetros para acercarlos. El horario de trabajo aproximado es de 6 horas al día 

Utilizará el crédito en la preparación del terreno donde cultivara, comprara abonos. Semillas, fertilizantes y otros útiles para sembrar los granos básicos. 

Sus sueños son comprar  y sembrar en mayor cantidad su producto para tener mejores ingresos de la venta. Para su familia él desea que ellos se esfuercen para que salgan adelante y cumplan sus sueños, además desea ampliar su negocio cultivando más productos agrícolas ya que actualmente solo siembra maíz frijol. Y desea sembrar caña, hortalizas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rufino is 54 years old and did not have a chance to go to school because his parents were very poor.  He is married and his wife cares for the home.  They have three children; one is a farmer and the others attend school.  Five people live at Refinio’s house and all depend on him for support.

Rufino is a farmer and has raised corn, beans, and other things all his life.  He learned this when he was a boy because his parents did this and he learned from them.  When he’s not working for himself, he does work as a laborer for whoever needs him.  This is an additional income that he has.  His customer’s work is a few minutes from his home, but he has trouble taking the supplies to his home because he has to travel 34 km away to get them.  He works about six hours a day.

He will use the money from this loan to prepare the land where he raises his crops.  He will buy compost, seeds, fertilizer, and other things to plant his basic grains.

His dreams are to buy and plant his product in larger quantities so he can have a better income from the sales.  He wants his family to work hard so they can come out ahead and achieve their dreams.  He also wants to expand his business and raise more agricultural products because he currently only raises corn and beans.  He wants to plant sugar cane, vegetables, and other things.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto de 59 años de edad, es una persona acompañada convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas .

Roberto  junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres con ayuda de sus hijos trabajan en las parcelas que alquilan  durante la mañana, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde Roberto cuida las vacas que poseen; mientras sus hijos se dedica a trabajar en otras parcelas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una  vaca que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche que ocupa para la elaboración de queso, crema que ofrece en su domicilio.

Él  planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de lácteos,  la siembra, y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca; podrá comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales y poder sembrar.
texts.en:
Roberto is 59 years old and married, with two children.  He has a sixth grade education.  He rises at 5:00 am, along with his wife and children who help him with his farming.

Roberto and his wife are farmers and he learned from his parents.  In the mornings he and his children work the land that they rent while his wife cares for the home.  In the evening Roberto cares for their cows and his children work other parcels of land.

He is asking for a loan through CREDICAMP to buy a cow that he needs to increase his milk production, which he uses to make cheese and cream that he sells from his home.

He plans to use his income from the sale of dairy products and from his harvest, along with the loan, to buy the cow.  He will be able to buy some land to which to pasture his animals and raise crops.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Venus works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Venus has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Venus would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
