Kristine is 24 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents.

She has a rice mill operation in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and reselling rice.  

Kristine is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill operation. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.ru: Мукимджону 43 года он женат имеет 2 взрослых детей. Он занимается торговлей кондитерских изделий. Жена также помогает торговле на рынке мужу. Мукимджон недавно начал перестройку дома и сразу хочет утеплить крышу для обогрева зимой. В этом году им пришлось очень тяжело так как их старая крыша протекает и подлежит ремонту. Было очень холодно. Недавно Мукимджон узнал от своих знакомых,что в Арванде выдают кредит для ремонта и строительства по продукту "зеленый кредит". Он планирует с внутренней стороны отделать строительными плитами из дерева и другими утеплительными материалами двойным слоем , которые не приносят вреда, для его семьи. Для того чтобы уменьшить потери тепла, «уходящего» через не утепленную крышу, а следовательно уменьшить расход энергии, затрачиваемой на обогрев нашего дома. Он посоветовался с специалистами строителями и данный вариант считается самым удобным и не имеет вреда здоровью, так как он заботиться о здоровье своей семьи. Он очень обрадовался,что ему выпала такая возможность утеплить крышу и дом. Его жена тоже была очень рада узнав об этом. Они решили получить кредит и провести долгожданную стройку и обратились в организацию Арванд. У них нет возможности откладывать большую сумму на строительство, так дети уже выросли а потребностей больше с каждым годом, а кредит от Арванд им на руку. Мукимджон и его семья очень надеются на поддержку от Арванд и осуществление своих планов.
texts.en:
Mukimjon is 43 years old. He is married and has two grown children. He sells confectionery items. His wife also helps him sell at the market. Recently Mukimjon started a home remodeling project. Most importantly, he would like to insulate his roof so as to  retain  heat in winter. This year has been very hard for them since their current roof is leaking and needs to be repaired. It was very cold. Not long ago Mukimjon learned from his friends that it is possible to obtain "green loans" from Arvand for home repairs and construction. He plans to install a double layers of panels made of wood and other materials that do not pose a health risk. 

In this way he will eliminate the current loss of heat through his non-insulated  roof, and thus consume less energy for heating the house. Mukimjon has consulted master builders, and this option is considered the most practical choice  as well as free from health hazards. Mukimjon is very mindful of his family's health. He was very glad to obtain this opportunity to insulate his roof and house. His wife was also very glad to hear these news. They decided to apply for this loan and carry out the long-awaited repairs, which is why they turned to Arvand. They are not able to save a lot for the construction work since their children are already grown, and there are more and more obligations to meet every year. The Arvand loan comes in very handy. Mukimjon and his family really hope to receive support from Arvand and realize their plans.

loans.use: to purchase ecological materials for home insulation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stuff to increase his stock to sell such as sugar, soft drinks, cookies, macaroni, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and reselling cashew nuts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns more income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell for her business buying and reselling cashew nuts. Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for three years. Lilibeth also earns an income from food vending, farming rice, and raising poultry.

She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, and soft drinks. Lilibeth has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and reselling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  

Lydia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of rice to sell for her business buying and reselling rice. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mae Susaine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mae Susaine works hard to support her family.

She has a business vending fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Mae Susaine is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell at her business vending fruits and vegetables. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Om –Fuad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om –Fuad and it consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 Yemeni rial (YER) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Mona is a hardworking woman. She is a 28-year-old married woman and lives in a rented house in a poor area. She is the leader of the group. Mona has started her business of selling accessories and cosmetics door-to-door three years ago. 

After her husband immigrated to Saudi Arabia, Mona assumed the responsibility of her family. She started her business with a small capital. Year by year her business improves more, but most of what she earns from profits go to the expenses of the family. She has good experience in her business. 

Thanks to her experiences, Mona deals with her own business with ease. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more cosmetics and accessories to resell to her customers.

She looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a small shop for selling accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and accessories to resale for her customers.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is married and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merla is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merla requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing net.

Merla has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net
